Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp lemon and lime aromas meet with a crushed sea-shell tone on the nose of this bottling. There's a taut feeling to the palate, where pome-fruit and stone-fruit flavors wander through the engaging texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2019 Jackson Estate Nielson Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This flavorful, well-structured and balanced wine offers fragrant peach and butter aromas. Tangy white-peach and green-apple flavors follow alongside a pleasant nip of tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brooks Note 2019 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is barrel fermented and left on the lees prior to bottling. Crisp green apple, lemon wafer and a hint of butter bring out well-rounded flavors that carry a hint of residual sugar. It's dry but not tart, and would be an excellent substitute for a Chardonnay.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2019 Surlie Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: From nose to finish, there's so much complexity to be found in this landmark German Pinot Blanc. It's dry and silken in texture, with delicate pear and yellow apple flavors anchored by veins of smoky, crystalline minerality and racy lime acidity. A subtle, steely wine in youth that will develop greater power and intensity with time. Best 2023–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2018 Im Sonnenschein GG Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Stony minerality extends from nose to palate, lending weight and gravitas to concentrated yellow peach and Mirabelle plum flavors. Sourced from volcanic soils of the Siefersheim vineyard, it's an intensely ripe, voluptuous Pinot Blanc anchored by firm strikes of steel and smoke. While a bit nervous in youth, it should blossom gloriously from 2023 to 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2018 Siefersheim Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Cutting notes of green melon and lime skin introduce this full-bodied but delightfully zippy Pinot Blanc. A well-priced, entry-level bottling from the grandmaster of German Pinot Blanc, it's a supple, fresh-fruited sip backed by a racy backbone of acidity and a long, chalky finish. Ready now but should reward through 2024, at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2018 Dry Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Wagner-Stempel's entry-level Pinot Blanc is a profoundly smoky, mineral sip. Apple, pear and lemon flavors are crisp and cutting, accented by zippy lime acidity and a firm, steely finish. A remarkably solid, weighty dry white that should drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2018 Gutswein Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Delicate notes of toast and hazelnut accent bristling yellow apple and Meyer lemon flavors in this delightfully fresh, piercing white. Dry and steely yet plump on the palate, it's remarkably well-priced for such a stately wine. Ready now but should drink well through 2024 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2018 Becker Family Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Delicate hints of toast, green apple and hazelnut skin introduce this dry, smoky Pinot Blanc. Light-bodied yet quite silky in texture, it offers concentrated pear and grapefruit flavors against a dramatic, smoldering backdrop. Freshly balanced and thirst-quenching, it's a lovely wine to enjoy through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2019 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a finesse wine, scented and flavored with apple skins as well as flesh. There are subtle suggestions of green pineapple and citrus, and the wine is balanced and quite refreshing. The overall impact lingers far beyond the immediate lightness of flavor.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2019 Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: Pretty white blossom and lime perfume distinguishes this lithe Mosel Pinot Blanc from heftier, stonier expressions of the grape from the Pfalz or Rheinhessen. It's a delightfully spry, feather-light sip that packs a punch of zesty lemon, green-apple and pear flavors. The finish is long and minty fresh. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Willems-Willems 2018 Saar Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Mosel)

Description: Pinot Blanc can be a quiet, subtle grape but Wittmann coaxes an abundance of crisp, vibrant pear and grapefruit flavors accented by toast and hazelnut here. Slim in profile and backed by a zesty mineral foundation, it's a fresh-footed, lime-inflected sip that should drink beautifully through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2019 Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Freshly cut pear and white blossoms abound in this light-bodied yet juicy white. Backed by zippy streaks of lemony acidity and a bristling mineral undertone, it's a dry, invigorating Pinot Blanc that should please a wide audience. At peak now–2024 but can hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Lucashof 2019 Trocken Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Wisps of smoke, lime blossom and pear collide in this fresh-footed dry white. Green melon and apple flavors are pristine on the palate, edged by a fine filigree of cut stone and a zesty lemon acidity that lingers on the finish. A refreshing, elegant wine that's ready now but should hold through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2018 Kabinett Trocken Weissburgunder (Baden)

Description: This is nicely differentiated from both Pinot Gris and Chardonnay, grapes it may often closely resemble. Here it occupies the middle ground, picking up the apple, pear and melon fruit of the former, and some of the buttery barrel toast of the latter. Overall it's fresh, balanced and moderately long.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2018 Estate Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe yellow plum and apple aromas are met with gentle warm-spice accents on the nose of this Pinot Blanc that was fermented and aged in French oak. It's rounded and rather full in feel, with juicy yellow fruit leading the way but grounded by more delicate warm spices, candlewax and a gentle floral kick.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hector Wine Company 2019 Pinot Blanc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This barrel-fermented wine features green and yellow apple flavors, edged with citrusy acidity. There's a hint of skin contact in the tart, sharp and well-defined finish. This should drink nicely over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2018 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A portion of this white is sourced from vineyards planted in 1983, making them some of the oldest on the North Fork. It kicks off with cohesive aromas of ripe yellow apple, pear, jasmine and lemongrass. These tones echo on the medium-bodied palate, where rounded, juicy fruit is met with bright, zesty acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2019 Estate Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Dry and intently steely, this light-bodied, electric white offers zesty pear and lemon flavors etched by flint and slate. It's a refreshing, zingy sip that's best enjoyed young but will hold through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2019 100 Hills Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Pretty white blossom and peach notes perfume this bang-for-your-buck Pinot Blanc. It's an unusually exuberant, fruit-forward expression of a typically shy grape variety that should be enjoyed young but its pert acidity and concentrated flavors should hold well through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2019 Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Notions of toasted hazelnut and wet chalk combine on the expressive nose. The palate is utterly concentrated but seemingly fizzing with bright freshness that adds lift to the nutty accent. Bright freshness and a creamy texture make an ideal picture. Drink 2025–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2018 Ried Haidsatz Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: The gentlest hazelnutty smoke plays on the nose and for now and obscures the bright lemon that illuminates the palate. The body has wonderful concentration and an inner, juicy core of pear and Mirabelle fruit, all held in a velvety, smooth embrace. It is this unusual combination of utterly slender freshness and soothing, textured depth that makes this wine so alluring. Drink now–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schauer 2018 Ried Höchtemmel Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: A reductive funk still hovers above the shy nose. A lovely textural element on the palate recalls fresh yeast and soothes the incipient zestiness that tingles. This is a baby which has yet to round out, but the elements for lasting development are there: depth and freshness. Drink 2023–2033.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2018 Ried Sulz Weisser Burgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: Subtle hazelnut and wet chalk on the nose have a quiet sense of summer blossom and lemon about them. The palate also has this gentle, nutty dimension from a kiss of oak. It is beatuiful, serene and elegant, as well as age-worthy. Drink now–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2019 Alte Reben Weisser Burgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: A shy nose reveals mere glimpses of freshly cut yellow apple, lemon and yeast. The palate is beautifully ripe and fresh at the same time. This needs a little more bottle age but will blossom in a year or two. its textural concentration, its freshness and pristine green pear and apple fruit stand it in good stead. Drink from 2022.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2019 Ried Jungherrn Weissburgunder (Vienna)

Description: Fragrant and floral, this wine offers a steely texture of elegant crispness and vibrant acidity. Given time in both stainless-steel tank and neutral barrel, it shows off an array of green apple and pear, with a backdrop of lemongrass and stone.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2019 Estate Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Los Carneros)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe green pear and lemon fill the nose and announce a gentle but wonderfully fresh wine. The palate holds true and presents a beautifully slender but creamy body, lifted by ample lemony clarity. The dry, vivid finish is filled with exciting zestiness and soothing creaminess.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Fuhrgassl-Huber 2019 Ried Schenkenberg Grinzing Weisser Burgunder (Vienna)

Description: A slightly smoky nuttinness blends in with the pear and lemon notes on the nose. The nuttiness continues on the palate and is cushioned by lemon, yeast and smoke. This deserves a little bottle age to soften its edges. Drink from 2022.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martinshof 2017 Reserve Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: In an excellent vintage for all the Brooks white wines, this Pinot Blanc is a particular success. The house style favors stainless steel, high acidity whites, which brings up the complex aromatics of citrus blossom and rind. The texture, minerality and flinty persistence provide a dense underpinning to a lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2019 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Bottled in screw-cap form, this lovely Pinot Blanc sourced from volcanic soils benefits from a few minutes of aeration before serving. It's a thrillingly slim, linear expression of Pinot Blanc marked by crisp yellow plum and pear flavors and a distinctly smoky, earthen undertone. Revitalizing acidity lends zip to the finish. At peak now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2019 vom Löss Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: Juicy notions of ripe Mirabelle plum fill the nose right away. The fine bubbles that rise almost carry a honeyed notion in them. The palate is creamy and fresh and has a pithy, slightly bitter phenolic backdrop that counters that rich juicy Mirabelle fruit. The finish is bone-dry and very fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steininger NV Methode Elementar Weissburgunder Weissburgunder (Österreichischer Sekt)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tight, well-defined apple fruit is buttressed with notes of fresh green herbs. There is a crystal-clear minerality underscoring the flavors and leading through a most refreshing finish. It's not a big, ripe wine, but excellent for this challenging vintage.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Anne Amie 2017 Twelve Oaks Estate Pinot Blanc (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Clean and crisp, this opens with fresh scents of herbs and citrus, and follows with tart fruit flavors of citrus and apple. Lemon is the dominant citrus note, and the tangy acidity reflects the moderate level of alcohol.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lady Hill 2019 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Take your palate on a delicious run down a gantlet of lemon, lime, tangerine, apple and peach, all buoyed by sappy, juicy acids. It's lightly toasty, with a refreshing snap to the finish. And finally, new labels that do justice to the quality inside the bottle.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Adelsheim 2018 Bryan Creek Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A testament to why this grape deserves more attention in the region, this white begins with lightly aromatic hints of jasmine, pear and wet stone. The palate is brisk and taut, offering underripe orange, apple peel and nectarine flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Wilkes 2019 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smooth, suave and slightly nutty, this layered and concentrated wine is luxurious in texture and ripe in flavor, offering peach, pear and vanilla notes that are tasty and lingering.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Longevity 2019 Vintner Select Pinot Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Description: This wine's subtle nose shows subtle yeast, citrus and green pear. The palate adds bright, juicy notes of stonefruit and ripe citrus, giving rounded and friendly freshness. Soft, fine mousse adds just the right amount of sparkle. It is light, elegant and oh so balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin NV Cuvée Julien Dopff Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Notions of creamy lemon yeast burst with every bubble that rises to this wine's surface. The body adds a subtle, textural yeasty backdrop while bubbles continue to froth, transporting more freshness against a mellow background. Slender, bright, vivid and smooth, it makes a beautiful aperitif.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: This wine's nose is still shy, giving away just a little yeastiness and slight reduction. The palate shows some chalkiness in texture and a gentle, smooth but lively mousse. All this is backed by fruity ripeness and bright freshness, striking a dry balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Anne de K. Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Bestheim NV Anne de K. Blanc de Blancs Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Creamy, scented freshness reminiscent of white pear flesh and summer blossom is diffused by this wine's lively mousse. The exquisitely light body is bright, with a dry, refreshing finish. It would make a gorgeous aperitif.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim NV Brut Premium Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: In this wine, the scent of ripe Mirabelle fruit is complemented by gentle creaminess and citrus. Fruitiness also pervades the light, bright palate, where frothy mousse seems to push citrus freshness with urgency and charm. It's a full-fruited but slender wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim NV Excellence Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: On the nose of this wine, the bubbles carry a gentle note of Mirabelle plum to the surface, edged with lemony freshness. The slender palate offers fine foam, subtle fruit and citrus brightness that suggests lemon meringue pie. The finish is lemony, taut, fresh and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Helfrich NV Cuvée 1934 Pinot Blanc (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Floral and pretty in apple blossom and lemon peel, this well-made white is high toned in acidity and freshness. It tastes of stone fruit and citrus, finishing steely and dry on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Etude 2018 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)

Description: This wine's shy nose gives just hints of citrus but the frothy bubbles give a real sense of lemony freshness accompanied by gently ripe Mirabelle fruit. Slight yeastiness makes things softer but this slender wine is all about liveliness and froth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Lemon, green apple and a hint of chalk all make an appearance on this wine's fresh nose. The palate conveys lightness, freshness and ease, enlivened by frothy bubbles that burst into even more lemony freshness. It is lively and dry on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé NV Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Subtle pear notes appear softly at first on the nose and palate of this wine but are then propelled by lively, frothy mousse that adds vivid prickle. The body is light, dry and very refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim NV Mayerling Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Only subtle hints of ripe apple show on the nose of this wine, suggesting freshness and ease. The palate comes in with ripe juiciness on a light, dry body, made lively by the frothing fizz. Slight yeastiness rounds things out on the dry, refreshing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ruhlmann NV Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Notes of Golden Delicious apple and fresh lemon are lively and open on this wine's nose. Light, juicy and foamy, the palate delivers refreshment and ease. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas NV Mosaik Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Notes of Golden Delicious apple and fresh lemon are lively and open on this wine's nose. Light, juicy and foamy, the palate delivers refreshment and ease. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas NV Mosaik Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Description: Notes of white currant and lemon immediately rise from the glass. On the palate of this wine, the fruit takes on a riper hue, recalling juicy apple. Subtle creaminess and lively froth make this slender, fruit-driven wine fresh. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé NV Comtes de Ribeauvillé Brut Pinot Auxerrois (Crémant d'Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Crisp acid-driven fruit flavors of lemon, grapefruit and green apple dominate this wine, and turn it somewhat generic. It's a steely wine, with scents of iron filings and tight skin flavors wrapping up the finish. Try it with fresh caught trout.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2019 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Stainless-fermented, this perennially beautiful white is bursting in fruity, floral aromas and flavors of fresh apricot, peach and fig. Crushed rock, oyster shell and wet stone contribute a minerality that intrigues and adds complex composure, with high-toned acidity integrated throughout.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2019 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit and spring blossoms mingle together in the glass along with a delicate scent of fresh bread dough. Elegant and savory, the polished, precise palate delivers ripe apple, pear and creamy white peach before a hint of white almond graces the finish. Bright acidity keeps youthfully tense and fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Spessa 2018 Santarosa Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: Aromas of freshly baked bread align with ripe yellow apple, botanical herb and citrus on this rounded white. Notes of cedar and a hint of ginger accent a core of creamy Bartlett pear before a white almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Russiz 2018 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: Spanish broom and white stone fruit aromas form the inviting nose along with a whiff of dried botanical herb. Savory and polished, the mouthwatering, elegant palate features creamy pear, white peach and lemon drop candy alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a white almond note. One of the best recent vintages I've had from the estate.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiopetto 2018 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: Aged partly in tonneaux, this polished white has alluring aromas of spring blossoms, ripe white orchard fruit and dried botanical herb. It's both creamy and crisp, showing white peach, yellow pear and a dollop of vanilla alongside vibrant acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2018 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: Hawthorn and yellow pear aromas form the nose. The aromas segue over to the smooth, crisp palate, along with white peach, baking spice and a hint of white almond. Vibrant acidity lifts the creamy, delicious flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kettmeir 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The Foris vineyard is a cool site in southwestern Oregon. This is a tart, tangy, tasty style of Pinot Blanc that features crisp lemon, grapefruit, apple and a touch of white peach. It's a spicy, delightful wine for those who revel in high-acid whites.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Foris Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite dry and tart, this is a wine for acid lovers. It opens with light scents of white flowers and flavors of tart tangerines. The theme continues with hints of botanical herbs and a squeeze of lime. The concentration and balance belie a wine with alcohol under 12%.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2019 David's Block Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart yet still rather soft on the palate, this brings a mix of light green herbs, apples, lemons and limes. The overall weight is light and tangy, the balance spot on. It's a most refreshing style to enjoy through 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2019 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Smooth, rich and rounded in texture, this comfortably fruity wine is most notable for the luxurious mouthfeel but it also has a snap of green apple to back the full pear notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Light and fresh, though not quite fully ripened, this pleasant wine conjures up impressions of celery, watercress, white radish and green apple. It's an elegant wine, with a finishing dash of cinnamon spice.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brigadoon 2019 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine combines a rich texture with ample fruit flavors and good underlying acidity that gives a sense of freshness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Foundry 2018 Schrader Ranch Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Description: Ken Wright has been making exceptional Pinot Blanc for at least 15 vintages, and this may be the finest to date. Remarkably, the price has remained steady over that time, while case production has grown. This is a showcase for the often overlooked variety, with Asian pear and crisp apple fruit, highlighted with fresh herbs, white pepper and lemon verbena. It was sourced from Freedom Hill vineyard.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Ken Wright 2016 Pinot Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: Planted in a cooler plot of this great site, this wine impresses in its effusive, bright core of crisp apple, melon and wet stone. It is lengthy and lively, with a grainy grip to the texture that finishes creamy and soft on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2018 Durell Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delicious, sexy wine impresses with its leesy, textural mouthfeel, its mountain spring freshness, it's crisp lemon and grapefruit flavors, and its underlying minerality. One-quarter was fermented in neutral French oak, the rest in stainless steel. A dash of minty wintergreen trails the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: St. Innocent 2016 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Freshly cut green pear peel is fresh and inviting on the nose while a lovely hint of bitter almond plays alongside. The palate is fresh and brims with tender, fresh fruit. Think yellow apple flesh and green pear vivacity, all spiked with lovely lemon. This is slender but has a generous, concentrated core of fruit and a textured, appetizing finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tinhof 2019 Weissburgunder (Burgenland)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is always one of the most compelling bottlings under the Miller family's J. Wilkes label. Rounded aromas of yellow apple, Tuscan melon, wet gravel and sea salt show on the nose, while the palate combines apple with nectarine and peach. The underlying savory saltiness carries into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Wilkes 2018 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: A closed nose suggests nothing but gentle freshness. The palate is light an dry, hinting at lemon and apple, ringing with purity. Subtle spritz tingles with freshness and presents a zesty finish with a yeasty tang.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2019 Gutswein Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a sharp and focused wine, with bright fruit flavors of apple, white peach and lemon zest. There's plenty of acidity to add zip to the finish of this stainless-steel fermented and aged wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2018 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Dusty mineral tones mingle into elegant toast and hazelnut in this vibrant Pinot Blanc. While dry in style, the palate is juicy, offering fresh lemon and pear flavors edged by tea tannins and honeycomb. The finish is quite long and voluminous. Best enjoyed through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2017 Dry Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: While demure on the nose, this light-footed Pinot Blanc offers crisp red-apple and lemon flavors accented by hints of nut, toast and white blossom. It's silky in mouthfeel but invigorating on the finish. Enjoy now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2016 RS Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Appellation: Puget Sound, Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Examples of this variety are an extreme rarity in the state. Aromas of apple, pear, dehydrated banana chips, spice and musk are followed by sleek fruit flavors livened by vibrant, lemony acidity. The acidity keeps the interest up. The finish has a kiss of smoke.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Skagit Crest 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Blanc (Puget Sound)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Aromas of lemon peel and apple announce a fruit-forward sparkler, yet there's a bit of salty grit underneath that lends balance. It's juicy and fleshy on the palate, with playful bubbles that deliver flavors of racy citrus and tart apple. It extends nicely on the finish in a streamlined lemon tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2017 Estate Sparkling Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Prominent notes of toasted barrel and nut accent crisp white plum and grapefruit here. It's a briskly composed and easy-drinking but elegant Pinot Blanc to enjoy now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2017 Becker Family Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: The freshness of just cut, green Conference pear peel on the nose is made even fresher by hints of lemon. The light palate is slender but has lively, juicy pear fruit, gentle creaminess and brims with ease and dry freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Höpler 2019 Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Zenith Vineyard and fermented with native yeast, this offers interesting details of straw, bee pollen and lemon curd. There's a dusty sensation in the mouth, and fruit flavors mixing citrus and crunchy apple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Silas 2015 Enna Hay Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Juicy bites of crisp pear and yellow apple are accented by spice and smoke in this vibrantly fruity Pinot Blanc. Dry and briskly balanced, it's an easy crowd-pleaser but stately, too, with a richness and silkiness that builds on the palate. The finish is long, lingering on hints of nut skin and sweet spice.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pflüger 2018 Quarzit Trocken Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Whiffs of fresh white grape and crushed minerals introduce this ebulliently juicy, blossomy white. While dry and quite slim in profile, it's a powerful thirst-quencher packed with zesty Asian pear and lemon flavors. The finish lingers long on a pristine grapefruit tone. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2018 RK Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: Vibrant, transparent grapefruit and pear flavors extend from nose to finish in this fantastic value Pinot Blanc. Full bodied and juicy on the palate, it's balanced by zesty tangs of lemony acidity and a lingering note of smoked hazelnut. Enjoy now–2022 to maximize its vital style.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2018 100 Hills Dry Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This well-defined wine mixes fresh flavors of apple, Asian pear and a suggestion of honeydew melon. It fits nicely between the fleshy fruit of Pinot Gris and the broader palate of most Chardonnays. This is confined, crisp and focused, a good choice for appetizers and lighter entrées.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elk Cove 2019 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Lively acidity keeps the ripe, luscious honeydew melon flavors in balance while a smooth, buttery texture is energized by citrus accents. This full-bodied, vegan wine has distinct, enjoyable parts that come together as a whole.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2019 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: No frills here—the wine was put through all stainless-steel fermentation and no malolactic. The result is a clean and refreshing expression of crisp apple fruit, with a touch of white radish. The underlying wet-stone minerality keeps it lively through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2019 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Fresh green notes lend a welcome herbaceousness to pert white grapefruit and lemon flavors here. Dry and full bodied, it's a concentrated, zesty white with an invigorating acidic backbone. The finish is moderately long with a touch of earthiness lingering. Drink now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Drautz-Able 2018 Estate Bottled Gutswein Pinot Blanc (Württemberg)

Description: Hints of crushed minerals and crisp green apple on the nose gain intensity on the palate of this full-bodied, juicy Pinot Blanc. It's a concentrated, voluminous dry wine sharply balanced by hits of lime and lemon acidity. A refreshing, fruity wine best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2018 Wachenheim Ortswein Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Round and creamy, this gorgeous white opens with aromas of chamomile, white stone fruit and baking spice. The delicious palate doles out succulent yellow apple, ripe pear and honeydew melon before a mineral-driven finish. This shows the incredible potential of Pinot Bianco in Alto Adige.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2018 Sirmian Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Fermented and aged in large casks, this offers delicate scents of mature white stone fruit, cedar and toasted nut. On the medium-bodied, elegant palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe pear and apple while a hint of baking spice graces the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2017 Passion Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Elegantly understated but enticing, this has aromas of white stone fruit, crushed herb and a whiff of Alpine wildflower. The savory palate boasts great finesse, delivering ripe pear, apple and creamy white peach set against crisp acidity. A mineral note suggesting tangy oyster shell marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2019 Plotzner Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of apples and pears carry over to the delicious palate along with creamy white peach and green apple. Bright acidity and a hint of flinty mineral lift the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girlan 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Inviting aromas of ripe apple and a yeasty whiff of bread dough segue over to the delicious palate along with creamy yellow pear and a hint of lemon drop. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hazelnut note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2018 Berg Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite clear in the glass, this bottling from historic Bien Nacido Vineyard vines is brisk and acid-driven on the nose, with hints of fresh lime peel and wet stone. The wine zips with glee across the palate, delivering more citrus and long lingering acidity that drives into a Key lime cheesecake crust-flavored finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Steele 2018 Pinot Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas of spring blossom and white stone fruit. Round and medium bodied, the palate presents ripe Bartlett pear, white peach and a hint of baking spice alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girlan 2018 Platt & Riegl Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: The immediate sensation is of a rich and creamy wine, with upfront flavors of sea salt caramel, buttered pear and vanilla. It perks up with balancing acidity, more of that fresh pear fruit and a dash of dried thyme.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and white stone fruit shape the nose. On the savory palate, fresh acidity accompanies ripe apple, creamy pear and honeydew melon. It closes on a white-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Peter Zemmer 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Inviting aromas of mature white stone fruit, baking spice and a whiff of baked bread waft out of the glass. Tangy and elegant, the savory, medium-bodied palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, creamy yellow apple and a ginger note alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colterenzio 2019 Cora Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Alpine herb and white stone-fruit aromas segue over to the elegant, savory palate along with hints of hazelnut and ripe pear. It's medium bodied and fresh, with tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2018 Anna Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of hay, chamomile and golden apple shape the delicate nose along with hints of nut. It's linear and elegantly structured, offering yellow pear, Meyer lemon and hazelnut set against racy acidity. It closes on a saline-like mineral note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2018 Quintessenz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of green apple carry over to the crisp, tangy palate, along with hints of pear and honeydew melon. Bright acidity lifts the fruit flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Fermented and aged partly in barrique, this has aromas of cedar, French oak and yellow apple. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with a hint of toasted hazelnut and a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elena Walch 2018 Kristallberg Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Savory and medium-bodied, this has delicate scents of spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff Alpine herb. The elegant, creamy palate doles out yellow pear, white peach and a hint of white almond that lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elena Walch 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of ripe apple and Bartlett pear cross over to the round medium-bodied palate, along with a hint of lemon drop and fennel. It's savory and fresh, with a tangy mineral-driven finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pfitscher 2018 Langefeld Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Yellow apple, Bartlett pear, white-peach and white-almond aromas shape the nose. The aromas follow through to the fresh, supple palate along with a hint of Alpine herb that accents the round, lingering finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Kurtatsch 2018 Hofstatt Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of apple, pear and white spring flower shape the nose. The aromas carry over to the creamy palate along with honeydew melon and a citrusy note. Tangy acidity brightens the fruity flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2019 Merus Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate scents of white spring flower, pear and the barest whiff of bread crust form the alluring nose on this elegant white. On the dry, refreshing palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow apple and lemon before a hazelnut finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Erste Neue 2018 Puntay Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This has delicate but inviting aromas of spring blossom, white stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. On the savory, medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies ripe apple, pear and a hint of white almond before a saline finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Erste Neue 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Alluring scents of spring wild flower, white stone fruit and crushed stone waft out of the glass. Elegant and polished, the savory palate delivers ripe pear, apple, white almond and saline mineral notes alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Apple, pear and baking-spice aromas waft out of the glass along with a whiff of wild sage. The aromas carry over to the full-bodied palate along with a note of toasted hazelnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2018 Penon Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of ripe apple and yellow pear follow through to the savory palate along with hints of white almond and dried sage. Tangy acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Tramin 2019 Moriz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicately scented, this has aromas of yellow apple and hazelnut. The aromas follow over to the racy, rather lean palate along with delicate notes suggesting acacia honey and saline. Crisp acidity gives it a clean, dry finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2018 Vial Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit and green melon lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with ripe pear and apple. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kupelwieser 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate scents of pear and a whiff of chamomile waft out of the glass. On the savory palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe apple and lemon before finishing on a hazelnut note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2019 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Scents of oak, cedar and hazelnut shape the delicate nose along with a whiff of peach on this light-bodied white. The linear, ethereal palate offers yellow pear, saline and a hint of butterscotch alongside crisp acidity before closing on a hint of almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2018 Haberle Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicately scented, this has light aromas suggesting yellow pear and apple. The scents make their way over to the fresh, rounded palate along with a hint of bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castel Sallegg 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This has a shy nose evoking toasted nut and oak. The aromas carry over to the palate along with bitter yellow-apple skin, saline and coffee bean. It has fresh acidity but is shy on fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colterenzio 2018 Berg Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This rare example of the variety is high-toned in floral aromas on the nose. There's a metallic tinge to the palate that presents as sour.                      Virginie Boone
Name: August Briggs 2018 Dutton Ranch Pinot Blanc (Russian River Valley)

Description: Fresh notes of ripe, yellow apple dominate the nose of this wine, flanked by some yeasty funk. The palate presents zesty freshness buffered by that mellow apple ripeness to present harmony. Concentrated freshness is the chief feature. The finish gives hints of chalk and tapers to purity. Drink now–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 La Fontaine aux Enfants Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Sun-warmed straw and subtle yeast are evoked on the shy nose of this wine. The palate adds citrus brightness to these mellow, earthy notions and makes sure this wine stays on the slender side, despite that mellow, inviting note of golden straw. The finish is long, dry, expressive and pervaded by gentle lemon freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Vin Non Filtré Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Mirabelle and apple hints are gentle but pure on the nose of this wine. On the palate they become fully fleshed, shining with juicy Mirabelle ripeness. The finish is lively, bright and dry, expressing generosity and pristine fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Leon Beyer 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine is shy, giving only an idea of freshness. The palate follows this with gentle apple fruit that has a lovely intensity of ripe lemon. The finish is dry, bright and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2018 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A gentle but appetizing note of red apple plays on the nose and then brightens the light, fruity and easy body of this slender white. The wine is fresh and vivid with a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Subtle and fresh notes of pear can be discerned on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with welcome freshness that holds notes of rich Mirabelle and ripe lemon. This brightness and vigor spread throughout this slender, light wine that finishes with refreshing dryness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Lemon and yellow apple on the nose of this wine promise both ripeness and freshness. The palate duly delivers with generous fruit and a slender but generous, vivid and very fresh body. The dry finish underlines the full fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2018 Les Trois Terroirs Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle but fresh hints of green pear on the nose of this wine continue seamlessly on the palate. The body is slender but generous, suggesting ripe, juicy Mirabelle. The finish is dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine hints shyly at lemon freshness, while the palate brings fresh pear and lemon-zest purity. The finish is dry, bright, juicy and enlivening.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A hint of yeasty funk sits on the bright apple nose of this wine. It also appears on the concentrated, apple-fruited and earthy palate that has a spicy, yeasty and saline edge. The finish is dry, apple-scented, salty and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Kritt Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Bright, almost zesty notes of ripe lemon appear on the nose of this wine. The palate adds fresh red apple fruit and presents notions of generous ripeness and bright freshness. A gentle texture reminiscent of apple flesh leads onto a dry, vivid finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2018 Rayon de Lune Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Faint notes of red apple and wet earth appear on the shy nose of this wine. The palate offers gentle fruitiness, presenting notions of ripe pear on a light, bright and fresh body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Faint but juicy hints of ripe, yellow pear appear on the shy nose of this wine. The body offers ripe pear tinged with earthiness and mellow creaminess, conveying the generosity of the warm 2018 vintage.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2018 Val Saint Gregoire Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The subtle freshness of green pear on the nose creates brightness. The palate of this wine broadens into creamier, riper apple flesh but the finish of this light, easy wine remains bright, dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2018 Découverte Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of Mirabelle plum and apple on the nose of this wine turn into an equally delicate palate of lightness, freshness and ease. The wine offers juiciness, freshness and harmonious balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2018 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Enticing aromas of ripe russet pears fill the nose. The palate of this wine delivers juicy pear ripeness and freshness on a light, slightly textured, mouthwatering body. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Les Natures Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe pear on the nose of this wine become clearer and juicier on the balanced, fresh palate. The body is rounded with fruit but finishes dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Cuvée Chevalier Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: A whiff of flint is all the nose of this wine gives away. The palate presents gentle, fresh red apple and subtle, bright but ripe lemon. A slight yeasty edge gives texture to this light, dry and harmonious wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2018 Les Iris Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Only the gentlest hint of pear escapes from the shy nose of this wine. The palate presents a picture of slender, fresh, bright pear fruit on a body that is harmonious, light and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Bright and subtle notes of green pear on the nose of this wine promise freshness. The palate presents that pretty fruit in a harmonious, bright and juicy palate with a fresh, dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notions of fresh green and yellow pear rise from the glass. The palate of this wine has the same fruity freshness and brims with green pear notes. The dry finish has a little warmth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K. Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe pear rise gently from the glass, framed by a fainter hint of lemon zest. The palate brings brightness and verve to ripe, juicy Mirabelle plum that defines this dry, vivid and balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Midelberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A gentle notion of Mirabelle on the nose leads to equally subtle fruit on the fresh palate. The body is light, bright but rounded, finishing dry with a pure note of ripe lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2018 Cuvée Les Amours Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Slight notes of green and yellow pear play appetizingly on the nose of this wine. Zesty freshness shows on the easy, dry but taut palate. It's clean, bright and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose allows glimpses of some pear and earthiness. The palate of this wine comes in with freshness and a pithy concentration that gives a little texture, too. The finish is bright, rounded and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2018 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Hints of apple and pear appear shyly on the nose of this wine. The palate presents these in a package of harmonious, lemony freshness, full of ease and fruit. It finishes dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Hints of mellow, ripe apple flesh rise from the glass. The palate of this wine adds creaminess as well as lovely apple freshness. The body is rounded, the finish dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2018 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle, fresh notes of ripe pear on the nose of this wine also appear with brightness on the palate. Generous fruit is met with fresh yeastiness on the juicy palate that comes to a fresh, clean and dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 Grande Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Fresh notes of ripe, green pear are vivid on the nose of this wine. The palate tones this down. It's juicy, balanced and dry, pleasantly tinged with aromatic pear ripeness. The finish is dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ruhlmann 2018 Plaisir Fruité Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Juicy red apple flashes occasionally on the shy nose of this wine. The palate also presents ripe and tart red apple and conveys easy, bright juiciness. It finishes dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2018 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The ripe aroma of russet-pear skin and flesh makes for an appetizing nose on this wine. The same fresh, ripe juiciness appears on the palate where a tinge of earthiness adds some pith. The finish is dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2017 Evidence Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine offers slightly lemony freshness. The palate has earthiness and pithiness brightened by lemon. A little warmth shows on the dry, concentrated finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henry Fuchs 2018 Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Creamy freshness on the nose is reminiscent of Golden Delicious apple flesh. The palate of this wine is fruity, vivid and light. It has a rounded, fruity and dry finish, with a hint of flinty reduction.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction appears on the nose of this wine. The palate presents fresh green pear and bright lemon freshness on a harmonious, dry and easy package.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2018 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose gives almost nothing away. The palate of this wine portrays juicy, ripe but fresh pear on a balanced, medium body. The finish is dry, bright and juicy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2018 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Aromatic notions of ripe pear escape the shy nose. The palate of this wine adds a pithy, slightly bitter edge to this rich, expressive fruit and presents a balanced, rounded but fresh white with a dry, fruity finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Somethig creamy, almost milky, on the nose of this wine accompanies subdued pear notes. The palate strengthens that creamy pear feel and adds an earthy element of pithiness. The finish is dry and still creamy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine François Schmitt 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose conveys a hint of lemon and pear freshness. The palate of this wine follows suit with gentle pear presented with brightness on a light, dry and harmonious body, with a fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2017 Tulipe Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Fresh and almost lifted pear notes are tinged with hints of chamomile. The palate of this wine is juicy, bright and harmonious edged with a pithy, earthy and slightly bitter texture. The finish is dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frédéric Mallo 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Mellow creaminess on the nose of this wine also shows hints of ripe, yellow pear. The generous palate carries a smidgeon of sweetness. This wine is mellow, fruity and really rounded.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An unusual whiff of tropicality hovers on the nose, which is dominated by pear fruit. The palate of this wine comes in with ease and generosity but loosely defined fruit. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose on this wine allows only a glimpse of pear fruit. This pear dominates the easy-drinking and balanced palate with its juiciness. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2018 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Faint notes of ripe pear on the nose of this wine become more expressive on the palate. A slight pithy bitterness counters the generous fruit and guides the wine to a fresh, bright and dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Apple, citrus and an exotic hint of mango play on the subtle nose of this wine. The palate broadens out and overlays earthy roundness on the fruit. The finish is dry, light and easy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Apart from subtle apple hints, the nose of this wine does not give a lot away. The palate broadens out into ripe apple and earthiness but stays dry and light.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bott Frères 2018 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Hints of ripe pear and Mirabelle on the nose of this wine are subtle. The palate is fresh and light, dulling the fruit with a hint of earthiness. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2018 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose of this wine just hints at some earthiness. The palate is rather neutral, presenting just a hint of ripe pear blended with that earthy tinge that lasts to the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Louis & Fabienne Mann 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Some earthiness surrounds shy pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate still carries a yeasty funk and presents a pithy, earthy core with little fruit. The finish is dry and clean.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2018 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: This lush, complex and layered wine pushes Pinot Blanc to a quality level rarely seen at this price. Citrus, apple and pear fruit flavors abound. Though fermented entirely in stainless steel, there is an appealing hint of pie crust running through the finish. Juicy and delicious, this is a perfect Chardonnay alternative.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Maysara 2018 Autees Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Bone-dry, leesy and textural, this is built upon bracing minerality. Despite the ripeness, the fruit flavors favor citrus skin more than flesh, with accents of white peach and green apple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Zesty green-apple and crushed mineral tones on the nose extend into crisp lime and lemon on the palate here. This is a refreshing and linear Pinot Blanc that finishes with a hint of smoke. Best now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2017 Gutswein Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Stone fruits, notably apricot, occupy the central palate here, and the flavors spread out broadly with a saline undertone. Two-thirds were fermented in stainless steel, and one-third in a terra-cotta cigar amphora. That oxidative vessel seems to have dulled the brightness of the fruit somewhat, but on balance this will drink nicely a bit sooner. Enjoy now–2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: David Hill 2018 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Entirely barrel fermented, this generous, flavorful wine is built upon apple and pineapple fruit, with supporting, citrus-infused acidity. Further barrel aging has helped to round out and polish any rough edges.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2017 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: Juicy, sun-kissed yellow-peach, pineapple and lemon flavors are accented by a whiff of blossom in this fresh fruity Pinot Blanc. It's forward and fruity but dry and invigorating too. Best enjoyed now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reverchon 2018 Saar Trocken Weissburgunder (Mosel)

Description: Subtle hazelnut notes, a tinge of smoke, chalk and lemon freshness create an elegant and enticing nose. The palate unites these elements in a lovely, concentrated fashion and reveals a core of energy, drive and warmth that nonetheless remains anchored in a certain cool earthiness. This is lcomplex, layered, creamy and aromatic. Ignore Weissburgunder at your peril. This is an Austrian secret. Drink 2022–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2017 Ried Haidsatz Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: Bright, vivid lemon notes share the nose with a wonderful creaminess. The palate continues in this sunny, pure lemon and cream vision, presenting a concentrated body that comes on light, tiptoe feet. This is fresh but creamy, slender but mellow and oh so wonderfully textured. This makes the case for Weissburgunder, aka Pinot Blanc, of the highest order. Lovely now, it is certain to evolve. Drink now–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schauer 2017 Ried Höchtemmel Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: A lifted note of blossom honey and dried lemon rind immediately signals some evolution. More time in the glass reveals notes of wet stone and cream. The palate is concentrated and anchors all these flavors in a deeply chalky core of depth, honeyed but absolute dryness and lifted intensity. A shaft of freshness keeps everything on the straight and narrow. A wonderfully evolving Pinot Blanc. Drink now–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Weinrieder 2015 Kugler Lagenreserve Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: Hints of chalk and creaminess on the nose play alongside fresh, pristine pear notes on the nose. The palate comes in with lovely freshness that underlines the rounded, ripe fruit and that textured, stony palate even more. A lovely juiciness pervades everything on this concentrated, bone-dry wine, which has wonderful length and lasting flavor.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2018 Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: Slight reduction gives a funky edge to the earthy notes on the nose that are touched by lovely yellow apple freshness. It is on the bright palate that the full force of freshness shines through, like a burst of lemony, bright light that plays against a lovely chalky, fine-boned texture. Testament that Weissburgunder, aka Pinot Blanc, is such a vivid, underappreciated variety that nonetheless packs concentration, finesse and expression. Lovely now, it is certain to evolve. Drink now–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2018 Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: Most subtle hazelnut notes envelop smoke and creaminess on the nose. The balanced palate is rounder than expected with a mellow stone fruit juiciness that sits well with the subtle smokiness that speaks of well-handled oak. A lovely texture completes this subtle, rounded and mellow yet fresh wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hillinger 2017 Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: The shy nose gives little away but hints at subtle pear and cream. The palate comes in with measured roundness, speaking of the warmth of the vintage but contained by a certain chalky coolness and bright lemon freshness. There is a lovely texture and a concentrated midpalate that leads to a long, rounded finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tinhof 2018 Weissburgunder (Leithaberg)

Description: The subtle hazelnut notes of oak play enticingly on the nose alongside notes of ripe, juicy green pear. A subtle creaminess has lemon highlights. The palate is rounder than expected, with generous pear fruit, packing in the sunshine of the vintage. Despite its relative mildness, this strikes a balance and finishes on stone fruit and cream.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Netzl 2018 Ried Altenberg Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)

Description: Slightly funky yeast jumps from the glass and mingles with ripe stone fruit aromas of juicy Mirabelle plum. The palate presents a lovely, pure vein of freshness surrounded by yeast. This is bright, lively, slender, bone-dry and very individual. It deserves food to show its real mettle.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2017 Ried Sulz Weisser Burgunder (Südsteiermark)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: An intense nose of ripe pear and pineapple melds with gentle jasmine and warm spice tones in this medium-bodied white. There's depth to the full, rich orchard fruit flavors on the palate, with bright shots of tropical fruit and citrus lending ample lift.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Palmer 2018 Estate Bottled Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A bright intensity of yellow pear, butter, wax and warm spice carries this Pinot Blanc that sees time in neutral French oak. It is creamy and full on the palate in melon and pear flavors, yet properly lifted by integrated acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hector Wine Company 2017 Pinot Blanc (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Any earthy nose of button mushroom melds with sharp citrus and apple tones in this traditional method sparkling wine made from Pinot Blanc. The palate boasts a gentle foam that carries deep, concentrated flavors of citrus and orchard fruit, with bright, persistent acidity pushing it along.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2013 Reserve Sparkling Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Sourced from a vineyard on the west side of Seneca Lake, this white is rounded and sultry in flavors of waxy lemon, pear and white blossoms. There's a bit of astringency on the midpalate, with crisp orchard fruit lingering on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Heron Hill 2017 Reserve Morris Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This is an easy, breezy white that offers delicate aromas of lemon, banana peel and pollen on the nose. It is light and spritzy on the palate, driven by crisp citrus and pear flavors.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lieb 2018 Estate Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine is slathered in buttery aromas and flavors and quite mouthfilling in texture. Butterscotch and baked apple dominate the palate. It's very showy and focused on butter.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2017 Rivin Ranch Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Faint green pear and lemongrass aromas lead to the light, spritzy palate. There's ripeness to the sweet orchard fruit and lemon flavors, making this an accessible, easy wine to enjoy.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: An easy nose of pineapple, guava and lemongrass carries to the medium-bodied palate. Tart tropical fruit flavors hold court, with brisk acidity lending a sharp edge.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2017 Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A smooth, rich mouthfeel carries vivid and bright green-apple and lemon flavors in this medium-bodied wine. Good depth and concentration are complemented by bracing acidity for good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rodrigue Molyneaux 2018 Pinot Blanc (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This mouthwatering wine has bright apple and citrus aromas, a tangy feel on the palate and fresh, just-ripe fruit flavors. It's right on the money in terms of balance and will be a great apéritif wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2018 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of beeswax, hay, field flower and white stone fruit drift out of the glass. The elegant understated palate is a bit more restrained than the nose, offering mature yellow apple, toasted almond and a hint of lemon zest.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Pinot Bianco (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: The lift of musky botrytis strikes the nose with its honeyed intensity. The palate is luscious and rich, with the notions of golden honey and honeycomb. All this is edged by concentrated candied lemon peel that shine with richness. Everything about this is intense. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steindorfer 2015 Beerenauslese Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Stony and elegant, this full-bodied, creamy Pinot Blanc offers bright tangerine and orange peel flavors offset by savory hits of smoke and nut. A satisfying, voluminous wine with a long, subtly gripping finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2017 Kalkgestein Weissburgunder (Pfalz)

Description: Zesty tangerine skins, crushed slate and smoke mingle into crisp apple and lime in this dry, medium-bodied Pinot Blanc. It's a silky, supple sip edged by hints of savory herbs and lingering mineral tones. Drink now–2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2017 Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Nahe)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A clear, crisp and perfectly focused wine, this offers brilliant apple flavors, so pure and transparent they seem etched in crystal. Highlights of lemon zest and grapefruit compound the brightness of the finish. Just 16% was fermented in neutral oak, the rest in stainless.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Adelsheim 2017 Bryan Creek Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Perfumed notes of orange blossom, lemon and hazelnuts introduce this delicate Pinot Blanc. Laser light and zippy on its feet, it's a juicy, easy-quaffing wine that balances bright acidity against crisp apricot and grapefruit flavors. Enjoy now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Willems-Willems 2017 Saar Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Mosel)

Description: Delicate hints of hazelnut, toast and smoke accent lemon and white grapefruit here. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a refreshingly easy-drinking but elegant wine finishing on a nuanced touch of bramble. Drink now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2017 Siefersheim Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Tart and dry, this brings a dusty note across a range of tangy citrus fruits, particularly lemon and grapefruit. The acids are emphasized somewhat by an astringent, chalky finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: William Rose 2018 Pinot Blanc (Oregon)

Description: This Serbian wine has aromas of lemon-lime, stone fruits, nettles and geranium leaf. On the palate there are flavors of apricot and peach with a balanced, crisp finish.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Zvonko Bogdan 2017 Pinot Blanc (Serbia)

Description: Pinot Blanc is typically a shy white grape, but this powerful, voluptuously textured wine offers intensely concentrated apricot and white peach flavors marked by whiffs of blossom and lime perfume. It's decadent but balanced neatly with zesty acidity and a reverberating mineral tone. Delicious already but should improve through 2037.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2017 Im Sonnenschein GG Weisser Burgunder (Pfalz)

Description: Floral, waxy and crisp, this perennially lovely white is generous in stone fruit, lemon, lime and pear, with bristling acidity buzzing beneath the scenes. The crispness mellows in the glass to wide appeal as complex characteristics of white pepper and flint build.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2018 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)

Description: Notes of smoke, biscuit and crisp yellow apple introduce this nuanced Pinot Blanc. Edgy and mineral compared with the more voluptuous Kirchberg GG bottling, it's elegant, with a thrilling, steely finish. Smoke tones should integrate better from 2022, but this is a wine that will reward cellaring through 2035 and hold further beyond.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2015 Oberrotweiler Henkenberg GG Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: Pinot Blanc is often a rather nondescript grape variety, but there's remarkable depth in this silky, full-bodied bottling. Sunny yellow apple and tangerine flavors are dusted by savory hints of crushed stone and white mushroom. It's luscious and silky but balanced by pert lemon acidity and a lingering mineral tone. Drinks well already but is structured enough to improve through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2015 Oberrotweiler Kirchberg GG Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: Zesty lime, lemon and grapefruit extend from nose to finish in this thrilling, exceptionally racy Pinot Blanc. While bold in body, it's a lean, razor-edged wine studded by hits of cut stone and dusty mineral. The finish is long and steely.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2017 Mandelberg GG Weisser Burgunder (Pfalz)

Description: Creamy yellow apple, hazelnut and spice abound in this plump, juicy Pinot Blanc. Dry and silky on the palate, it's an easy-drinking wine with succulent orchard-fruit flavors but is elevated by lingering mineral tones and a zesty lime finish. Ready now but should hold through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Nägelsförst 2017 Tautänzer Ortenau Trocken Weissburgunder (Baden)

Description: Crisp, floral and textured, this is a varietal white rare to Carneros and in new hands, with winemaker Joe Nielsen. Aged partially in stainless steel, partially in neutral oak, it has focused acidity, with refreshing tones of lemon, lime, peach and grapefruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ram's Gate 2018 Estate Pinot Blanc (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Intense in juicy, succulent fruit, this opens with lovely botanical aromas and flavors of ripe lime, grapefruit and fresh apple. The flavors are layered and deep, lifted by refreshing minerality.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elk Cove 2018 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: This is an intensely mineral white offering crisp lemon and lime flavors against a backdrop of crushed stone, salt and steel. Dry and light-footed in style, it's a lean, steel-edged Pinot Blanc with a refreshing margarita-rim finish. Enjoy now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2017 Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: Prominent notes of toast, spice and vanilla accent creamy white peach and yellow apple here. Full bodied and quite decadent in texture, it's a rich dry white that's balanced by pert lemon acidity and a hint of crushed earth on the finish. Enjoy now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Nägelsförst 2017 Luft & Liebe Weissburgunder (Baden)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bright yellow gold and pungent with scents of lemon, grapefruit and green pineapple, this complex yet delicate wine hues closely to the well-established Eyrie style. Perhaps it seems lean to some palates, but it comes with the details to enhance its fruit flavors, adding touches of dried leaf and a refreshing salinity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2017 Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The Foris Vineyard is near the California border in southwestern Oregon. This wine is crisp in nature, focusing on apple, pear and melon fruits. Half was fermented in stainless, the other half in a mix of French and American oak. It's nicely textured and lingers through a clean, mineral-drenched finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2017 Foris Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: This traditional method blanc de blancs is made from 100% Pinot Blanc. On the nose it offers hints of smoke and biscuit that mingle into juicy flavors of fresh yellow apple and pear. It's creamy in foam but balanced by vibrant acidity and a clean, chalky finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Designation: 1 Karat Crémant Blanc de Blancs Brut
Name: Nägelsförst NV 1 Karat Crémant Blanc de Blancs Brut Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a juicy and fruity wine, with forward and delicious flavors of apple and pear. The lively acidity adds a touch of grapefruit, keeping the mouthfeel fresh and the finish zesty.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2018 Seabreeze Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: As the low alcohol would suggest, this leans heavily on its strong acidity. Fruit flavors are beyond tart, almost sour, with lemon drop tang and tension. But it's not a one-dimensional wine, and there's grapefruit and other citrus as well. It would be a fine match for raw shellfish or grilled octopus, or served as an appetizer wine with salted nuts and cheeses.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2018 David's Block Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Brooks wines often fall on the tart side stylistically, and this one brings a lip-smacking mix of lemon and grapefruit. The ample acidity keeps it refreshing and long, finishing with an impression of wet stones.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2018 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tart and loaded with citrus fruit flavors, this zesty wine mixes lemon, lime and pineapple highlights, propped up with plenty of acidity. Briefly aged in stainless and neutral wood, it's a refreshing light wine that could even be tried as a mixer in a fruity punch.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brigadoon 2018 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Unless you are madly in love with high-acid wines, this is likely to seem simply sour. Mashed apple fruit, searing acidity and very low alcohol for a bone-dry wine all suggest that some of the fruit may have been somewhat compromised. Chill well and drink up.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser 2017 Thistle Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)
