Description: This lacks much in the way of fruit, but what's there is green. That said, there's something in the nose that seems past ripeness also, and the bitter phenolic finish does nothing to help.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2016 Estate Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Description: It's always a joy to taste the old vines of Chalone, and this bottling captures their unique qualities, starting with aromas of apple syrup, hazelnut and toasted pecan. The palate offers almond, Meyer lemon and a creamy oak flavor that lingers on the tongue for a long time—all very unique elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seabold Cellars 2018 Rodnick Farm Old Vines Pinot Blanc (Chalone)

Description: Apple blossom and fresh apple flesh notes on the nose signal freshness as well as subtlety. The light palate is bright and fresh and has a lovely earthy edge that lends texture. This is bright, pure, harmonious and utterly appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2018 Ried Seeberg Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Inviting aromas of ripe white stone fruit, baked bread and a hint of hazelnut waft out of the glass. Round and medium bodied, the elegant palate delivers creamy yellow apple, mature pear, toasted almond and a mineral note suggesting flint alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of white spring wildflowers, apple, chamomile and a whiff of nut float above the glass. The rounded, medium-bodied palate offers creamy yellow pear, unsweetened lemon drop and tangy mineral alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Muri-Gries 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruits, spring wildflowers and a whiff of honey all mingle together. On the rounded, structured palate, a mineral hint of graphite accompanies mature yellow apple and peach.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Quintessenz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Fermented and aged in casks, this has subtle aromas of white stone fruit and hazelnut. On the polished palate, fresh acidity lifts yellow apple, white peach, oak-driven spice touched by bitter almond. A hint of citrus drop signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2016 Passion Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Ripe orchard fruit, bread dough and dried Alpine herbs aromas slowly appear in the glass. Round and refined, the medium-bodied palate shows ripe yellow pear, golden apple and a hint of hazelnut alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gump Hof Markus Prackwieser 2017 Mediavum Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Subtle aromas of mature white stone fruits, grilled herbs and a whiff of bread crust shape the nose. Tangy and round, the polished palate delivers creamy yellow pear, apple and a hint of almond alongside a note suggesting flinty minerals.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gump Hof Markus Prackwieser 2017 Praesulis Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Even though most Pinot Biancos have subdued aromas, this has a lovely nose offering beeswax, white stone fruit and an enticing whiff of bread dough. The rounded if rather understated palate shows creamy yellow apple, white peach and beeswax alongside a honeyed mineral note. Bright acidity keeps it nicely balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Kurtatsch 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine opens in racy high-toned acidity and evolves to show a creamier lusher texture and style. Peach, lime and green-apple flavors develop around a moderate structure that refreshes and finishes dry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gloria Ferrer 2018 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)

Description: White orchard fruit and field flower aromas mingle with a whiff of bread dough. The medium-bodied palate offers ripe yellow apple, hazelnut and a hint of honeyed mineral, while fresh acidity carries over to a bitter almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Vial Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, bread crust and white stone fruit form the nose. The round palate shows finesse and class, offering creamy yellow apple, brioche and white almond alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2017 Haberle Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Notes of yellow apple ripeness are laced with zesty lemon on the nose. The palate unites all this into bright, friendly fruitiness on a light but slightly textured body that feels like peeled apple flesh. This is sunny, dry, fresh and wonderfully understated in its apple fruitiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2018 Gutswein Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: Honeysuckle, white peach and honeydew aromas take center stage on this expressive white. The tangy, savory palate presents ripe yellow apple, mature pear and a hint of citrus alongside fresh acidity and a mineral note reminiscent of crushed oyster shell.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Tramin 2018 Moriz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Mature yellow apple, coconut and oak-driven spice aromas slowly take shape in the glass. On the rather lean but structured palate, fresh acidity lifts dried apricot, ripe grapefruit and thyme before a butterscotch close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kettmeir 2017 Athesis Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Fermented in steel tanks and aged in large oak casks, this has soothing aromas of ripe orchard fruit and just-baked bread. The rounded, medium-bodied palate doles out creamy apple, ripe pear and a hint of toasted hazelnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Kurtatsch 2017 Hofstatt Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: White stone fruits, spring wildflowers and a whiff of bread dough all come together on this subtle, polished white. The tangy palate doles out mature green apple, pear and an almond note alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kettmeir 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: A rather neutral nose merely suggests easy freshness. The palate follows this with gentle lemon notes on a slender, fresh and wonderfully light, lemon-scented palate. This is dry, bright and utterly refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Höpler 2018 Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: A very prominent bruised apple notion appears before the full sweep of Golden Delicious fruit unfolds. The palate is equally full-fruited and as mellow as ripe apple flesh. The finish is dry and very fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kracher 2016 Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Subtle aromas of white stones fruit and spring flowers float out of the glass. The palate is elegant and subdued, suggesting yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of white almond alongside mild acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pfitscher 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried pear peels, freshly cut pomelo and very pithy citrus aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers dried orange peel, light apple flesh, a steely minerality and zippy acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Deovlet 2017 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals subdued aromas of mature orchard fruit. The palate is also rather subdued but polished, offering ripe apple and creamy pear alongside a hint of hazelnut.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Erste Neue 2017 Puntay Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of spring flowers, apple and a whiff of Alpine herbs come together on this. On the tangy palate, fresh acidity accompanies ripe pear, citrus and a hint of thyme.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Crushed thyme, alpine wildflower, beeswax and orchard-fruit aromas are front and center on this beautiful white. Proving just how well Pinot Bianco can do in Alto Adige, the creamy palate is loaded with finesse, delivering ripe yellow pear, creamy apple and citrus alongside tangy acidity. White-almond and stony mineral notes back up the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2018 Schulthauser Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: You'll find enticing scents of alpine wildflower, ripe orchard fruit and a hint of hazelnut on this elegantly structured white. Enveloping and savory, the creamy palate delivers yellow apple, yellow pear and white almond. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2017 Sirmian Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, French oak, toasted nut and citrus mingle together in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the elegant palate evokes mature yellow apple, butterscotch, grapefruit and bitter almond. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2016 Sanct Valentin Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: White stone fruit and crushed mint aromas appear in the glass. On the fresh polished palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe yellow pear, citrus, thyme and a hint of white almond before a crisp dry finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This polished white has aromas of white wildflower and white stone fruit. The smooth creamy palate doles out ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear and white almond alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicately scented, this elegant white offers enticing aromas of orchard fruit, alpine herb and a whiff of wet stone. Polished and fresh, the palate doles out creamy yellow pear, ripe apple and almond while a hazelnut note lingers on the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Peter Zemmer 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of acacia, oak, citrus and orchard fruit mingle together in the glass. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with mature yellow apple, cedar and spice before a lemon-drop close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: J. Hofstatter 2016 Barthenau Vigna S. Michele Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicately enticing scents of beeswax, honey and wildflower aromas mingle with whiffs of ripe apple. The aromas carry on to the medium-bodied palate along with a mineral note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelfeder 2018 Vom Stein Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Enticing scents of orchard fruit, baked bread and a whiff of Spanish broom come together in the glass. On the fresh, savory palate, you'll find creamy Bartlett pear, Rennet apple and a citrusy note while a hint of alpine herb marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kornell 2018 Eich Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Here's an expressive Pinot Bianco that opens with aromas of ripe pear, Spanish broom and a note of alpine herb. Round and tangy, the palate doles out honeydew melon, yellow apple and a hint of pineapple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Andriano 2018 Finado Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Linear and racy, this vibrant white has delicate scents of yellow stone fruit and white wildflower. The crisp palate offers yellow apple, citrus and a hint of saline alongside firm acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2018 Merus Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, oak, yellow spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose. The linear palate offers yellow pear, honeydew melon and bitter almond before a mineral note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colterenzio 2017 Berg Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: White stone-fruit and spring wildflower aromas come together on this. It's round and medium bodied, offering yellow pear, green melon and citrus alongside refreshing acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girlan 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Here's a full-bodied white that opens with aromas of mature yellow apple, beeswax and a whiff of chamomile. The aromas follow over to the soft ripe palate along with a honeyed note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castel Sallegg 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of spring wildflower, mature yellow apple and Bartlett pear carry on to the round palate along with citrus notes and a hint of white almond. Fresh acidity gives it a tangy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colterenzio 2018 Cora Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit and spring wildflower waft out of the glass. It's vibrant and linear, offering yellow apple, white peach and a citrusy note before a tangy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elena Walch 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals scents of beeswax and pear. It's linear and understated, suggesting ripe yellow apple, nectarine and citrus alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2018 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas evoking spring wildflower and ripe orchard fruit lead the nose. The rounded palate offers creamy yellow apple and a hint of grapefruit alongside soft acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2017 Dellago Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking adhesive bandage and citrus. It's lean and muddled, offering bitter medicinal herb, graphite and toasted notes but it lacks fruit richness. You'll also get a green note of powdered sage on the astringent close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castel Sallegg 2016 Pratum Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This looks to be the first vintage for a Kelley Fox Pinot Blanc, and there are two, both extraordinary. Here, stunning concentration pushes lush fruit flavors of Meyer lemon, Satsuma orange, Italian peaches and a touch of apple cider down through the palate, landing on a soft blanket of citrus peel. The depth and power are breathtaking.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kelley Fox 2017 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This looks to be the first vintage for a Kelley Fox Pinot Blanc, and there are two, both sourced from the Freedom Hill vineyard. The Barbie honors Kelley Fox's late mother, a fine artist, whose painting adorns the front label. Fermented in a single acacia puncheon with natural yeast, it's a leesy, textural wine with fresh citrus fruits and a long, racy finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kelley Fox 2017 Barbie Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Subtle mirabelle plum notes on the nose are inflected with ripe Amalfi lemon highlights. The palate continues the lemon precision and purity with wonderful concentration and poise, all the while presenting juicy ripe plum fruit. Well-judged creaminess adds texture. This is seductive now, but bottle age will reveal the true depth of fruit and freshness that are captured here. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2017 Alte Reben Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: Dried pear and subtle smoke hint at some development. The palate, poised with lemon freshness, presents a harmonious interplay of smoky oak, bright freshness and concentration. A very satisfying Weissburgunder that shows its mettle and demands food. It is lovely, long and layered.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martinshof 2016 Reserve Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: A certain creaminess is suggested among the yellow mirabelle plums. The palate stays vividly fresh but plays out that creamy, textured lemon theme. There is body but ripe zesty freshness reigns. This will benefit from bottle age. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Malat 2018 Ried am Zaum Weissburgunder (Wachau)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This opens with scents of orange blossom and citrus skin. It follows those flavors into a tart and sappy wine accented with subtle suggestions of juicy fruit gum. Fruit flavors emphasize crisp apple and a touch of cantaloupe.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Anne Amie 2016 Twelve Oaks Estate Pinot Blanc (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Lemon and white-blossom aromas introduce a palate filled with light and juicy ripe lemon and peach fuzz, with hints of clementine and zesty lime acidity. The finish is dry and chalky with notes of yellow apple.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Left Foot Charley 2017 Island View Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Description: Pale-lemon with a green tinge in color, this offers aromas of white flowers, white-peach fuzz and lime on a delicate nose. The bright palate displays charming flavors of ripe peach, Meyer lemon, orange blossoms and sunny acidity leading into a dry finish of crushed mineral with lime and clementine peels. Enjoy this simple and refreshing wine now.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Verterra 2017 Pinot Blanc (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: The nose of this Pinot Blanc is centered on grassy and floral notes joined by light hints of white grapefruit. Bright tingling lemon-lime acidity supports flavors of white peach, beach grass and citrus on the palate, ending with lingering tones of peach and lemon.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Rove 2017 Pinot Blanc (Leelanau Peninsula)

Description: White-tea and blossom aromas mingle with lemon zest and moss on the nose. The light and delicate palate follows suit with lemon, white flowers and hints of pithiness matched by juicy acidity. The long dry finish turns more pithy adding lime peel.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Bonobo 2017 Devil's Dive Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Old Mission Peninsula)

Description: Pear, white peach and delicate white-flower aromas are light on a rather pretty nose. The acidity is bright with light lemon and peach flavors, embittered by a pith note leading into the odd grassy and herbal finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Mari 2017 Neeson Vineyard Pinot Bianco (Old Mission Peninsula)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a rich and ripe Pinot Blanc. Fruit-forward flavors of peach, melon, tangerine and nectarine are in play, amped up by fresh, juicy acidity. Serve this lightly chilled, and drink through 2021.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2017 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: This Pinot Bianco has subtle aromas of Bartlett pear, cedar and ginger. The aromas carry over to the structured palate along with toasted oak and a bitter-almond finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta del Buonamico 2016 Pinot Bianco (Toscana)

Description: Aromatic notes of baked apple and pear pie, along with a touch of smoke on the nose, immediately promise intensity. The palate comes in with generous pear fruit as well as amazing, almost piercing freshness. It offers a wonderful contrast of rich fruit and raciness. Lovely now, it will be more mellow and balanced in the future. Drink until 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2016 La Fontaine aux Enfants Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: While subdued and mineral on the nose, this refreshing dry Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, offers crisp but juicy lemon and white-grapefruit flavors on the palate. It's medium bodied but supple and expansive, finishing on  lingering lemon pith and zesty mineral tones. Enjoy now–2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2017 Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: A subtle nose reveals only a slight lemon lift. The slender palate displays similar gentleness and subtlety. On the dry finish, the balance, harmony and concentration of lemon and white-pear flesh become apparent. It's a wonderfully subtle wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Very juicy, aromatic ripe pear notes dance on the nose. The lightness and exuberance on the palate is joyful but also pure, light and concentrated. It's a wonderfully pure, light and expressive wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2017 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The ripest notes of pear have a touch of honey about them on the nose. This attains a gingerbread richness on the palate as well as a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge. Rounded and unusually rich, this Pinot Blanc has a dry finish that's textured and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2015 Saint-André Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The ripe, aromatic glow of sun-drenched, yellow plum rises from the glass. The palate reprises this rich and aromatic fruit but cuts it with fresh, ripe and juicy lemon to create a fruit-laden, concentrated but light wine with attractive concentration and a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2017 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe juicy pear and fresh lemon have an aromatic tinge of maple syrup on the nose. The palate brings out lemon that is both buffered and carried by testural yeastiness. It's a gastronomic and very dry wine with lemon brightness and great refreshment.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Earth, stone, pear and lemon come together on a shy, restrained nose. The palate, however, bounces open with a core of bright lemon. This wine is slender and dry but also joyful and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2017 Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: A creamy lick of mellowness pairs with fresh pear fruit on the nose, before lovely tart, red-apple aromas come through. The palate has that same fresh but creamy quality, brimming with ripe, juicy pear and brisk apple. The finish is dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Creamy and mellow pear notes on the nose announce the flavors of the rounded palate. They are just as rich but cut with a zesty freshness that has a spicy hint of cinnamon. The finish is long, dry and even livelier.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martin Schaetzel by Kirrenbourg 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Faint notes of green and yellow pear on the nose mix with a quiet tang of lemon. The palate is dry, slender and gentle, with juicy fruit and great purity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Zesty lemon and vivid green-pear notes appear briskly on the nose. The palate follows the same patterns of pure and fresh intensity of lemon and ripe pear. It's a compelling, dry, fruit-driven and fresh wine with good concentration.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2017 Collection Terroirs Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The merest touch of russet-pear-peel aroma appears on the nose before hints of lemon join in. The palate continues in this earthy pear and light lemon fashion. It makes for a light, expressive, dry and very versatile wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2017 Les Jardins Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: While delicate in body and alcohol,  this elegant, dry Pinot Blanc offers a supple silken texture and crisply concentrated lemon and yellow-apple flavors. Its a refreshing easy-drinking wine with hints of caramel and smoked nut that linger on the finish. Enjoy now–2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: A tinge of earth clings to the ripe, almost juicy yellow-pear fruit on the nose. The palate is dry and bright with brisk lemon fruit. A lovely phenolic edge supports the lemon freshness to provide welcome structure. This wine is crunchy, firm and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Juicy, ripe and almost plump notes of pear play on the nose. The palate reins in this generosity with zesty lemon freshness. The finish is dry, concentrated and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2016 Tulipe Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An aromatic whiff of rose precedes the pear-fruited notes on the nose. The palate is concentrated, with lively pear flavors pervaded by lemon. It's a refreshing, brisk wine with a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Hints of lemon and green pear on the nose become fully fleshed and expressive on the dry, fresh palate. Bright lemon provides freshness and grip throughout. It's a refreshing wine with a lively, brisk finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2017 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A lively tinge of lemon enlivens notes of ripe, juicy pear on the nose. The palate continues with its lemon brightness in a most engaging fashion. The palate is zesty, dry and fresh with lemon highlights.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2017 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Pear and lemon fullness, weaker on the nose but fully present on the brisk and vivid palate, pervades this wine. It displays effortless ease in its full-fruited, expressive lightness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An earthy hint of reduction and yeast still clouds the nose. The palate, however, brims with purity and a friendly pear and lemon interplay that puts freshness and ease center stage. The finish is dry, brisk and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2016 Kritt Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A subtle nose shows faint hints of ripe pear. The palate comes in with juicy freshness that enhances those ripe pear notes. Lemon accents get their due on the dry, zesty finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Faint but highly aromatic notes of Williams pear tease on the shy nose. Slender but pleasantly textured, the dry palate gives full rein to the mellow pear flavors while staying trim. The finish is dry, concentrated and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2016 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose gives almost nothing away. With air the ripeness of yellow pear comes through. The palate itself is light, with some concentration but above all pure, bright lemon freshness that lifts the pear flavors. The finish is off dry, bright and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A faint flicker of lemon freshness appears on the shy nose. The light and dry palate has a lovely feel of pith and zest. Light-footed and pure but concentrated, it finishes with expressive lightness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Tender notes of freshly cut ripe pear appear tentatively on the nose. The palate adds earthy, fruity fullness, accentuated by a little lemon. It has quite a bit of concentration and a lasting fruitiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2017 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A yeasty touch still clings to the lemon and green-pear notes on the nose. The palate makes most of this textural element and disperses it with bright lemon throughout the fresh and dry palate. It's versatile, light but concentrated wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2017 Cuvée Les Amours Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, fresh and baked pear contribute to the fruity aromatics on the nose. The palate broadens out into fleshier pear, adding a lovely, pithy edge. It finishes dry and bright with lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2017 Val St Gregoire Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, juicy notes of yellow pear fill the nose and carry onto the lively palate with ease. Lemon brightens the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Bright lemon and white-melon flavors are accented by hints of crushed earth and bramble in this dry medium-bodied Pinot Blanc. Zippy tangerine acidity leads a moderately long thirst-quenching finish. Enjoy now–2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2017 Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Notes of aromatic, ripe Williams pear appear immediately on the open nose. The light, dry palate adds even more juiciness to the pear notes and has a refreshing, clean finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Rayon de Lune Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle pear and notes of lemon balm make for a gentle but fresh nose. The palate follows in that fine-fruited but fresh vein with tones of green pear and ripe lemon. It finishes dry, fresh and savory.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2017 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: A shy nose gives only slight glimpses of russet-pear peel and earth. The palate emphasizes a textural, earthy element with lemon crispness and finishes refreshingly dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A tender, fresh and pristine nose of Conference pear becomes fruitier and more intense on the light palate. This wine offers juiciness, full-on fruit and balancing freshness. The finish is just about dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2017 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An earthy touch informs a nose that is shy when it comes to fruit. The slender palate presents a stony, pithy lemon and pear flavor. Dry and rather subtle, this wine has a creamy finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2017 Les Iris Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle hints of fruit on the nose suggest freshly cut Conference-pear peel and a dash of lemon. The palate is light-footed, fresh and deeply pear-fruited. This wine is versatile, balanced and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2017 Découverte Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose has an earthy hint of ripe pear but is rather closed. Coming in gently, the palate offers very bright, pure lemon and a texture of yeast and freshness. This wine is refreshing and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2017 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Open, friendly notes of crisp green and ripe yellow pear fill the nose. The palate is light, dry and has a lemon streak of freshness that shows off the pure pear-fruit notes. This wine is clean and versatile.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2017 Portrait Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, almost mealy pear fruit on the nose suggests generosity. The off-dry palate follows suit with ample, ripe and very juicy, if also earthy, pear notes. Subtle tinges of lemon add freshness and the finish is just about dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Open, fruity notes of ripe russet pear make for an appetizing nose. That same, friendly, juicy pear fruit governs the light, easy, versatile and dryish palate.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2017 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows very clean aromas of lime blossom, lemon skins and white flowers. It's fresh on the sip, with ripe apple flavors that are edged out by lime.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Steele 2017 Pinot Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Appetizing notes of ripe, juicy yellow pear appear slowly but convincingly on the nose. The palate comes in with lemon freshness that accentuates the juiciness of the pear. This wine is rounded but fresh and very appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2017 Cuvée Balthazar Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Lemon-scented notes of ripe pear play on the nose. The palate is fresh, fruity, light and bright. This wine has an innate liveliness, freshness and a dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Rounded pear ripeness is apparent from the first sniff. The palate fleshes out the ripe, juicy pear flavors into a rounded body, aided by the merest dollop of sweetness. It finishes dry and lemony.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2017 Grande Reserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Almost voluptuously ripe notes of juicy pear dance on the nose. The palate has an earthy, phenolic edge that helps balance the medium sweetness. This wine is rounded but fresh, brimming with pear notes. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2017 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Aromatic, almost heady notes of ripe pear dance on the nose. The palate boosts all this fruit with a little medium sweetness but also adds earthy phenolics and subtle lemon for freshness. The finish is off dry and clean.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2017 Les Natures Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A little shy, the nose is nonetheless fresh with hints of lemon, earth and pear. The palate has lovely notes of ripe, juicy russet pear while remaining light, fruity, dryish and easy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Intensely ripe apple and pear flavors are juxtaposed by nervy lemon-lime acidity and clean mineral tones in this dry Pinot Blanc. It's light bodied and fresh, with hints of bramble and herb complexity on the finish. Enjoy now–2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2017 100 Hills Dry Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: With grapes sourced from the Deerhaven Vineyard, this is a fleshy wine that displays flavors of pear and grapefruit on the well-textured palate. From a 20-year-old site, the length and texture reflect the growing maturity of the vines.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Compton Family 2017 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: A neutral nose leads onto a friendly, mildly pear-fruited palate. Lemon and pear take over on the smooth, dry finish. It's a versatile, fruity wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2017 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An earthy, almost mushroomy scent clings to abundant notes of ripe pear on the nose. The palate is dry, full-fruited and fresh with pear. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2017 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A slight whiff of reduction has to wear off before the pear fruit rings through. The palate shows concentrated green pear, finishing dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2017 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Almost confected pear fruit rises from the glass. The palate has that same, lifted, almost heady, pear flavor but combines it with fresh, brisk lemon. The finish is off dry. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bernhard & Reibel 2017 L'Enfant Terrible Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Crisp green-apple and grapefruit flavors are moderately concentrated here but refreshingly tinged by minerals in this dry medium-bodied Pinot Blanc. It's an approachable zippy wine with a brisk cutting finish. Enjoy now–2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fitz-Ritter 2017 Wachenheim Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: The nose holds back but then opens out into a broad, rounded palate. An edge of earthiness provides extra interest.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Loberger 2016 Meissenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Blanc can sometimes be little more than a generic, neutral white wine, as is the case here. There's a sharp core of apple and hints of pear, with bitter skin flavors wrapping it up. It's functional, but charmless.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: A beautifully lithe apple and pear freshness rises from the glass. With a little air, a very subtle note of hazelnut appears. The palate is rounded and full and has a totally juicy richness of juicy pear with a wonderful bitter almond edge, despite its wonderfully slender body. This is lovely now with the exuberance of youth but really needs time to unfold and show its lovely texture. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tinhof 2017 Golden Erd Weissburgunder (Burgenland)

Description: The merest hint of smoke on the nose has a pleasant edge of lemon zest. The palate then unfolds with generous, lithe, bright pear fruit, always edged with that lovely lemon freshness. The palate has a pithy texture that reverberates with citrus freshness. Wait for this to unfurl. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hillinger 2016 Terroir Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: A hint of toasted hazelnut glints richly from the glass before sonorous, ripe pear notes appear. The palate also weaves these sonorous tones together and adds a lovely edge of fine lemon acidity. This is elegant, fruity, textured but lithe and made for the long run. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2017 Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: Very ripe notes of juicy yellow pear have a creamy, earthy element on the nose. Their creaminess continues on the full-fruited but fresh palate. It is that lactic roundness that lingers. The finish reveals a pleasant pithiness that will stand this in good stead. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tinhof 2017 Weissburgunder (Leithaberg)

Description: Ripe pear fruit on the nose has a hint of hazelnut and smoke. The palate has a lovely juicy core, countered by a pithy texture. There is so much fruit at the core that juicy Mirabelle plum peeps through. A lovely and subtle wine with the gentlest oak. Drink 2020–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Netzl 2017 Ried Altenberg Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the highest point in the Bieze vineyard, this crisp, beautifully defined wine bursts forth with ripe autumnal apple fruit, pear, highlights of graham cracker crust and a finishing hint of toasted coconut.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Harper Voit 2015 Élevage Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: A hint of vanilla and ripe banana escape from the rather closed nose. The palate then comes in with juicy pear and zesty but ripe lemon. This is elegant and wonderfully gastronomic in its unobtrusive versatility. Lovely and subtle. Drink until 2025.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2017 Jungherrn Weissburgunder (Vienna)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a pleasantly distinctive version of the grape, fermented and aged in stainless steel, yet with lovely apple and tangerine fruit and a wash of almond paste. The relatively low alcohol and suggestions of honey may mean that some grape sugar remains, and if that's the case, it works quite nicely.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Amity 2017 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: The winery continues its interesting experiment with this wine, in a blend in which almost half was aged in clay amphora, 40% in neutral oak, and 18% in stainless steel. It's an unusual mix—textured, softened up a bit, with a mix of lime, grapefruit and Meyer lemon fruit. The time in clay brings those drying flavors into sharp focus.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winderlea 2017 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe apple, nectarine and lime-peel aromas make for a very accessible nose on this bottling. There is compelling tension to the palate, where bright citrusy and yellow-apple flavors get a white pepper lift and ride on fresh acidity. It's a great white wine for many occasions.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Wilkes 2017 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Sourced from eight-year-old vines, this tangy young wine is bursting with tart grapefruit and pineapple fruit. It's leesy and refreshing, with underlying minerality and bountiful acidity.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Pinot Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A fine example of the variety, this wine is crisply defined and brimming with a mix of grapefruit, melon and kiwi flavors. It is fruit driven for sure, but detailed and textural, with lingering fruit tones that wrap smoothly into a clean finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Apolloni 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh, crisp flavors tilt toward green produce—daikon radish, celery and yellow apple. There's a dash of white pepper and a finishing hint of brioche.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2017 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Delicately scented, this has enticing aromas of ripe pear, white wildflower and a whiff of Alpine herb. On the juicy palate, fresh acidity supports mature golden apple, peach and a flinty note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Tramin 2017 Moriz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This is a lovely white, vibrant and citrus-driven in acidity and freshness and focus. Nicely melded flavors of melon, lime and grapefruit accent a light-bodied, elegant style that will do well as an apéritif or meal accompaniment.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gloria Ferrer 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)

Description: White spring flower and mature orchard fruit aromas lead the way along with a whiff of hazelnut. On the smooth, full-bodied palate, fresh acidity brightens juicy yellow apple, juicy golden pear and a hint of peach. A flinty note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2016 Vial Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Oak, crushed herb and white grapefruit aromas follow over to the palate along with pineapple and a hint of yellow apple skin. A tangy mineral note suggesting oyster shell lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2016 Quintessenz Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with aromas of wildflower and orchard fruit. On the simple palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe Bartlett pear and mature yellow apple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2016 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: A floral and herbal nose delivers rose, white pepper and lime. The palate offers plenty of acidity but is gentle and soft in feel, with ripe lime and grapefruit flavors that are rounded out by a blossomy note. A dry, citrus finish shows astringent acidity and a white pepper tone.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Messina Hof 2017 Dry Style Pinot Blanc (Texas)

Description: Earthy botrytis and a touch of maple syrup spice inform the lusciously rich, honeyed aromas. A spirity strength tingles on the nose. The palate streams across the tongue in generous sweetness, while spirit and spiky acidity counter this and leave you with a very lasting impression of barley sugar. Lemon and caramel are the chief markers that echo long after the last sip.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steindorfer 2015 Cuvée Klaus Beerenauslese Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Hints of smoke, crushed mineral and lemon zest are inviting on the nose of this dry, full-bodied Pinot Blanc. It's rounded and silky on the palate, but peppered by vivacious streaks of lemon-lime acidity that pierce through the finish. Enjoy now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2017 Vom Löss Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: While the nose is closed, suggesting crushed mineral and hints of spice, the palate offers more expressive tones of lemon, white grapefruit and bitters. This is a dry, medium-bodied wine, with penetrating lemon-lime acidity and lingering juiciness of citrus on finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pflüger 2017 Quarzit Trocken Weissburgunder (Pfalz)

Description: Pinot Blanc finds a home in the Côte des Bar region of the Aube. In this expression it shows a beautiful character, ripe, tender and very open. Warm white and yellow fruits shine this well-balanced, ready-to-drink wine.                      Roger Voss
Designation: Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs
Name: Philippe Fontaine 2014 Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

Description: Whiffs of spice, tangerine and dusty mineral collide on the nose of this dry, full-bodied Pinot Blanc. The palate bursts with racy white grapefruit and lemon flavors offset by a lusciously rich mouthfeel. It's a satisfying, textural wine with a long, lingering finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wechsler 2017 Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Matthew Driscoll's wines hit a consistently high standard, and this young Pinot Blanc deftly mixes several emerging trends in Oregon: whole cluster pressing, native yeasts and light exposure to all- (or mostly) neutral oak. Apple, peach and pear flavors come with a touch of cinnamon, and the sur lie aging adds a crunchy/creamy texture throughout.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: WildAire 2017 Stater Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: Crisp, cutting white grapefruit and pear flavors lend freshness to this full-bodied but invigorating white. It's silky and expansive on the palate but balanced by zesty acidity and a pleasant rim of astringency on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: It's often forgotten that Pinot Blanc is one of the permitted grapes in Champagne. Normally found in the Aube, it makes, as here, a wine softer than Chardonnay, with ripe white fruits and an open texture. This wine is attractive, fruity and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean Laurent NV Cuvée Blanche Brut Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine balances flavorful, ripe fruit flavors with subtle acidity and a smooth, polished texture. Light hints of flowers and pistachios add complexity on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This crisp and appetizing wine offers herb and apricot aromas, lip-smacking acidity and tempting flavors of dried herbs, apricots and mineral water. It is medium bodied, shows no signs of oak and will be very versatile with food.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brooks Note 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This sophisticated effort is highlighted by bright, polished fruit flavors of apple, melon and white peach. It's long and focused, fresh and immaculate, with no apparent new oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elk Cove 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A bright yellow gold in hue, this aromatically intriguing wine is loaded with wild pollens that give both scent and flavor a lovely dusty character. Tree fruits, clean straw and even a whiff of bread dough combine in a lingering finish, with buoyant minerally acids.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2016 Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Quite a solid wine for under $20, this bottling shows rounded pear flesh, ripe nectarine, yellow-grapefruit pith and a chalky touch to the nose. Crisp lemony acidity defines the sip, where broader apple-flesh flavors also emerge over time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J Wilkes 2016 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This vintage of the Pinot Blanc stands out for its aromatic and racy mix of green fig, apple and grapefruit flavors. The refreshing, drink-now style finishes with tongue-tickling minerality.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2017 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and textured, this lightly-ripened style offers jicama, daikon radish and white-melon fruit, with a peppery note. The wet stone minerality contributes to a clean finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2016 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Honey, apple flesh, wet stone and lime show on the layered nose of this bottling from an appellation in San Benito County. The honey-brushed palate shows orange cream and a hint of almond.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Pinot Blanc (Paicines)

Description: This sulphite-free Pinot Bianco is slightly hazy in appearance, with aromas of citron peel, lemongrass oil and thyme. There's heft on the palate, alongside tones of crunchy Asian pear and astringent lemon peel, ending on a slightly hot and yeasty note.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Taverna 2017 SenSO2 Pinot Bianco (Basilicata)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From the first sip on through, this wine just feels flat. There's varietally correct apple and pear fruit, but it's lifeless, and the finish is short and simple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lady Hill 2016 St. Columban Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: A touch of hazelnut, a note of distant smoke and subtle creaminess merge in this slender, light-bodied, lemony bright wine. On the palate, subtle texture tempers the citric freshness with a mellow touch. The finish is dry and long. Lovely now but sure to age effortlessly.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2017 Ried Seeberg Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Delicately fragrant, this savory white boasts scents evoking spring blossom, crushed herb, citrus and mature apple. It's juicy and round, offering ripe yellow pear, white peach and lemon drop alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Penon Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Savory and elegantly structured, this is a great expression of Alto Adige Pinot Bianco. It opens with aromas of apple, crushed rock and a whiff of toast that follow through to the refined medium-bodied palate along with citrus and pineapple. A salty mineral note energizes the succulent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Sirmian Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: White spring blossom, ripe apple and bread crust aromas segue over to the elegant, medium-bodied palate along with Bartlett pear and a hint of peach. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2017 Plotzner Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of Granny Smith apple, white grapefruit and white spring flower carry over to the elegant full-bodied palate along with a ginger note. It's balanced, with bright acidity that lifts the juicy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiopetto 2016 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: Mineral-driven, earthy and floral, this gorgeous white is elusive in fruit, youthfully demure and full of vigorous acidity. Lightly ripe peach and mango come into play midpalate, with a squeeze of lemon emphasizing the wine's vibrancy on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)

Description: Aromas suggesting ripe Concorde pear, yellow peach and dried herb carry over to the mature round palate along with a hint of hazelnut. It shows remarkable freshness and elegance for the hot vintage. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Russiz Superiore 2015 Riserva Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: This elegantly structured white offers aromas of spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. Savory and enveloping, the polished palate offers baked apple, mature pear, toast and vanilla alongside a candied-lemon-zest note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Spessa 2016 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: A very faint but pure note of ripe lemon plays on the nose of this wine. The palate still has some slight fizz from the ferment but displays the same lovely lemon note and adds green apple. It's light, dry, fresh and subtle, with a zingy, long and clean finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2017 Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: Fragrant spring flower, green apple and citrus aromas lead the nose on this bright, fragrant Pinot Bianco. Reflecting the nose, the savory palate doles out creamy pear, juicy lemon and a hint of white almond. It has a clean, refreshing finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2017 Merus Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: The lovely ripe pear and fresh white currant notes on the nose of this wine continue with subtle fruitiness on the slender, fresh palate. There's a slight, pleasant edge of distant smoke that, alongside vivid lemon freshness, adds to the concentrated flavors.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hannes Reeh 2017 Weissburgunder (Burgenland)

Description: This opens with heady scents of spring wild flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of crushed stone. Medium bodied and savory, the palate offers ripe green apple, creamy white peach and a note of pineapple set against bright acidity. A hint of nut wraps up the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2016 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This wine's gentle notes of russet pear peel and fresh, ripe apple suggest both texture and fruit. The pear and apple flavors fill the palate, framed by freshness and a lovely texture reminiscent of pear peel and lemon zest. The finish is dry, fresh, clean and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hannes Sabathi 2017 Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: Aromas of ripe citrus rind, toast, oak, mature orchard fruit and beeswax come together in the glass. The full-bodied palate offers yellow apple skin, bitter almond and a hint of butterscotch while fresh acidity lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2015 Passion Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of wild flower, baked yellow apple and citrus slowly take shape in the glass while the medium-bodied palate offers toasted hazelnut, mature pear and a note of lemon zest. It finishes on a slightly bitter note reminiscent of powdered sage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2017 Anna Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Alluring scents of white spring flower and green apple lead the nose. The aromas are duplicated on the fresh palate along with ripe yellow pear, while a hint of bitter almond marks the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franz Haas 2016 Lepus Pinot Bianco (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Aromas of ripe white stone fruit, oak, toasted hazelnut and a whiff of vanilla appear in the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers baked apple, butterscotch, lemon zest and a coffee note alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2016 Haberle Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: A faint floral note clings to this wine's tender hints of white pear and lemon. Everything about this spells freshness. It's subtle and light, with a lemony cloud of floral scent. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Höpler 2017 Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Delicate but alluring scents of bread crust, orchard fruit and citrus take shape in the glass. On the palate, bright acidity frames mature yellow apple, lemon, and bitter almond. It closes on a salty note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girlan 2016 Plattenriegl Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate scents suggesting white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit waft out of the glass. Round and full-bodied, the palate offers baked apple and toasted hazelnut. You'll also notice the slight warmth of alcohol on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori Bolzano 2016 Dellago Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Ripe green apple and juicy Bartlett pear aromas carry over to the round medium-bodied palate. A saline note marks the finish while tangy acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colterenzio 2017 Cora Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate aromas of white wild flower, beeswax and green apple follow over to the medium-bodied palate along with mature yellow pear and lemon rind. An almond note caps off the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Erste Neue 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Here's a fragrant Pinot Bianco that offers heady scents of spring blossom and green apple. The green-apple note carries on to the fresh linear palate along with white peach and Bartlett pear.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Fragrant spring flower and ripe pear aromas take center stage on this northern white. The fresh medium-bodied palate shows juicy golden apple, white peach and a hint of white almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelfeder 2016 Vom Stein Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This medium-bodied white opens with aromas suggesting white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. On the round palate, fresh acidity lifts green apple and citrus notes.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girlan 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: The nose of this wine has the lift of very ripe white currant berries. The palate is lithe, with a savory edge of hay and salt, more of that white currant fruit and an underlying streak of lemon. The body is light and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martinshof 2016 Ried Hausberg Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: Aromas suggesting toast, oak and coconut carry over to the palate, along with mature yellow-apple skin. A note of bitter almond closes the somewhat lean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Erste Neue 2016 Puntay Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Spring wild flower and yellow stone-fruit aromas delicately mingle together on this. It's full bodied, offering baked yellow apple, peach and mature lemon-rind flavors. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol that throws it off balance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kurtatsch 2016 Hofstatt Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting medicinal herb, toasted nut and a whiff of oak take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate doles out yellow apple, hazelnut, graphite and a slightly bitter note of ground thyme.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castel Sallegg 2016 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This has a rather shy nose that eventually reveals aromas suggesting mature apple, citrus blossom and a whiff of toasted nut. The apple note carries over to the round medium-bodied palate along with pear and a hint of beeswax.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Ronesca 2016 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: Vibrant white grapefruit and gooseberry flavors in this Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, are highlighted by zesty lime and lemon acidity. It's dry and full in body, but boasts a racy citrus lift on the midpalate and a lingering chalky finish. Its fresh fruity appeal is ideal now but should hold well through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2016 Kalkgestein Weisser Burgunder (Pfalz)

Description: While subdued on the nose, exuberant white-grapefruit and green-apple flavors penetrate through this dry full-bodied white wine. It's a richly textured wine offset by zesty crushed mineral tones and vibrant lime acidity. The finish is long but crystalline. Enjoy now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schäfer-Fröhlich 2016 Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Nahe)

Description: The name “Pur Mineral” is an apt descriptor for this intensely mineral wine full of dusty slate and river rock complexities. It's luminously fruity too offering pristine Muscat grape and pear accented by a hint of exotic spice. It is dry in style yet rich and expansive in mouthfeel.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Rudolf Fürst 2016 Pur Mineral Weisser Burgunder (Franken)

Description: A gorgeous array of mineral tones anchor this vivacious medium-bodied white wine. Ripe juicy tangerine and grapefruit flavors are accented by hints of pollen and dusty earth. While creamy and textured, it finishes lean with a bracing hit of lime acidity. Drink now through 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wechsler 2016 Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's fresh, ripe pear flavor is accented by touches of tart orange and lemon peel. Though technically dry, it has enough residual sugar to gently round off its youthful edges and keep the alcohol rather low.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2017 David's Block Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: Racy lime acidity is offset by sunny pear and kiwi in this crisp medium-bodied white. Dry in style and enriched by a hint of cashew on the midpalate, it finishes long with juicy squirts of white grapefruit. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2016 Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Steel and crushed minerals abound in this taut, nervy Pinot Blanc. Lime and green-apple flavors are cutting and spry, augmented by grippy hints of lime pith. Dry and medium bodied, it finishes long on a lingering chalky tone. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2016 Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though not labeled as such, this was made entirely from Crannell vineyard fruit and fermented in stainless steel. It's a lively mix of pear, apricot, starfruit and lemon curd notes, with crisp and juicy minerality. In short, it's lip-smackingly delicious, with impeccable freshness.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2017 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Sourced from an acre of the estate planted in 2009, this well-made wine tastes perfectly ripe. Flavors of white peach, radish and jicama meld with ample acidity on the palate. Overall, this is well balanced and lingering.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Cellars 2016 Pinot Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from southern Oregon, this shows amped-up fruit and gentle acidity, resulting in very tasty, almost-tropical flavors. Barrel fermented using indigenous yeasts and aged in a mix of stainless steel and neutral wood, it delivers lush melon and banana flavors, with a creamy yet lively mouthfeel.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sass 2015 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: Exuberant notes of blossom, guava and red berry waft from nose to finish in this forward Pinot Blanc. While dry and medium bodied on the palate, it's creamy and textural with a lingering, pleasantly astringent finish. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Nägelsförst 2016 Dry Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: From the vineyard made famous by Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, here is an aromatic white, steely on the nose in lemon oil and white flowers. On the palate it is lushly layered and velvety, bright with heft.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Three Sticks 2016 Pinot Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Light bodied and bracing in style, this dry Pinot Blanc offers zesty green-apple and lime flavors. It's a lean, revitalizing wine but finishes a shade richer, on a lingering notes of honey and cashew. Drink now through 2020.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Willems-Willems 2016 Dry Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the low alcohol, this wine does not lack for richness. Its waxy bee pollen scents lead to grapefruit, apple and lemon peel flavors. Stylish acids keep the finish clean and crisp. Drink now and over the next couple of vintages.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: David Hill 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: This full-bodied white is a clear demonstration of the extraordinary potential of Pinot Bianco in Alto Adige. It opens with delicate white flower and ripe orchard fruit scents while the creamy palate delivers mature apple, yellow pear and juicy citrus notes. It's well balanced, with tangy acidity and a savory mineral vein that further energizes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terlan 2015 Vorberg Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Apple, white peach and honeyed nut suggestions follow over to the round, ripe palate in this wine. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors while a savory mineral note lingers on the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Russiz Superiore 2016 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: This wine's enticing green apple, citrus and spring blossom aromas follow through to its medium-bodied, savory palate, along with a note of nectarine zest. Fresh acidity and energizing mineral accents lift the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Andriano 2016 Finado Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with yellow apple, citrus blossom and toasted oak aromas. Those segue over to the vibrant palate, along with tangy lemon drop and butterscotch hints.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2014 Sanct Valentin Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: A touch of white blossom joins subtle pear on the nose. This subtlety of flavor and expression carries right on through the slender, taut, fresh and light palate. There is something very fresh and tender here, a subtle wine for subtle food with a dry lemony finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Strauss 2017 Classic Pinot Blanc (Steiermark)

Description: This wine's white spring flower and Granny Smith apple aromas follow over to the palate, along with a citrus note. Tangy acidity lifts the juicy flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Peter Zemmer 2017 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, is often noted for its neutrality, but it is unctuously rich and textural in this wine, with invigorating strikes of white peach, lemon and lime. This is anything but neutral. Full-figured yet stately, it's a lavish complex wine that lingers long on silken streaks of honey and waxy lemon peels. Enjoy now through 2031.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2016 Im Sonnenschein GG Dry Weissburgunder (Pfalz)

Description: Bold notes of smoke and struck flint recede gradually, revealing prettier tones of grapefruit, lemon and lime. Full in body yet anchored by spine-tingling acidity, this elegant wine offsets concentrated citrus flavors against savory tones of herb and dark mineral. Tasted in early 2018, it's still a taut, nervous wine that should meld nicely from 2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2014 Henkenberg GG Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Description: Restrained notes of pineapple and tart stone fruit introduce this zesty, intensely mineral white wine. It's delicate in mouthfeel but silky and mouthwatering, lingering on notes of honey, tangerine and crushed slate. The finish is brisk and crystalline.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2016 Siefersheim Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: While initial notes of smoke and earth take some aeration to fade away, there's a bounty of fresh fragrant grapefruit, pear and quince awaiting on the palate of this elegant Weissburgunder. It's a fantastically rich, textured white wine balanced by crisp tangerine acidity and a finish that's steely and precise.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wagner-Stempel 2016 Gutswein Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Pronounced aromas of earth and smoke subside to reveal delicate yellow-apple and pear notes here. The palate is dry and vivacious, marked by crisp apple and lime flavors. The finish is zesty, ending on a revitalizing shower of crushed minerals.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ökonomierat Rebholz 2016 Dry Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From one of Oregon's value producers, this crisp white wine should fill a lot of picnic baskets this summer. It's simple, clean and loaded with yellow and green apple flavors. A touch of cinnamon spice and a lingering taste of graham cracker add depth and length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Apolloni 2016 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: This thoroughly delicious wine showcases a flavorful mix of pear, peach and tangerine. Ripe and juicy the smallest touch of residual sugar is perfectly intertwined, building both concentration and texture. A dash of spice further livens up the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Konzelmann 2016 Lakefront Series Pinot Blanc (Niagara Peninsula)

Description: Hailing from Luxembourg, this Pinot Blanc has aromas of lemon juice and freshly cut pineapple. The palate offers flavors of lemon curd, quince and a touch of vanilla. There's also a hint of salinity on the soft and smooth finish.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Domaines Vinsmoselle 2015 Côtes de Grevenmacher Premier Cru Pinot Blanc (Moselle Luxembourgeoise)

Description: Earthy, buttery aromas precede generous fruit flavors in this medium to full-bodied wine that is mouthfilling and broad in texture. The contrast between a savory, earthy side and a more crisp and fruity one makes it satisfying to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2016 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: Though common in Oregon, this variety is essentially unheard of in Washington. Bright apple and spice aromas lead to broad feeling fruit flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cerulean 2016 Acadia Vineyards Pinot Blanc (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Z'IVO's Pinot Blanc is an obscure clone called Gouges, after the Burgundy winery that first isolated it. It's exceptionally dense, textural and racy, with scents and mouthfeel close to Chablis, with the same underlying minerality. Oyster shells and sea-breeze accents come with tart melon fruit and a touch of lime zest.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Z'IVO 2013 Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: An aroma of ripe pear makes an appearance on the nose. The same pristine and abundant tone plays on the palate, supported by fresh lemon. Balance and concentration are an ideal counterbalance to a racy vein of acidity. The finish is utterly refreshing and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose offers a hint of pear and a touch of lemon. These tones are reflected on the slender, dry palate, with concentration and ample fruit at the core. A lovely, light-bodied and elegant wine with a lasting finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2016 Réserve Clos des Capucins Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The best of an outstanding white wine lineup, this enters the palate with the clarity of a mountain lake. The clean and crisp fruit flavors of melon and white peach gently pull in accents of butter and caramel, without any single component dominating. It's very fine winemaking.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Helioterra 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: A touch of Mirabelle plum joins a fresh Conference pear note on the nose. The same fresh, clean flavors are abundant on the refreshing palate, which is toned, dry and has lovely concentration and poise.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: There is an intriguing floral streak on the otherwise subdued nose. The palate is dry and has a pithy, zesty and slightly bitter edge that gives structure and weight to this concentrated wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2016 Vieilles Vigne Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The steely, crisp fruit has been softened up a bit by barrel fermentation, which also adds a light toasty note. The core remains firm, with freshly sliced apple and pear fruit and a smooth lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2016 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: Zippy and fresh, this dry, medium-bodied Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, offers loads of pristine apple and tangerine-peel flavors. It's concentrated yet sprightly in mouthfeel and finishes with lingering complexities of sea salt and smoky nuts. Drink now through 2022.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pflüger 2016 Quarzit Trocken Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Pure Conference pear notes dominate the nose and palate. This shows some concentration that is balanced by fresh acidity. The finish is dry and fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Succulent and fresh, this puts out clean crisp flavors of lemon-lime, grapefruit and a touch of white peach. It's nicely supported with ample juicy acidity. Put a slight chill on it and drink now through 2020.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Only slight hints of ripe pear reach the nose. The palate offers more fruit and the textural element of pear peel. This is fresh clean and has a lovely mouthfeel. The finish is pristine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Both lemon and ripe pear meet on the nose. It is the lemon notes that are foremost on the slender, dry palate. The finish is clean and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An earthy touch hangs over pear and lemon aromas on the nose. The palate offers bright lemon freshness, with a slightly savory streak on the light, refreshing palate. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Les Jardins Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose offers a sense of freshness and the palate follows suit, with clean outlines of Conference pear and lemon. There is moderate concentration and a juicy, refreshing finish that is dry and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An appealing aroma of ripe pear fills the nose. The palate is similarly abundant in fruit yet ultimately feels clean, dry and slender.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2016 Cuvée Les Amours Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Lovely, herb-edged notes of pear make for a refreshing and engaging nose. The fresh palate is juicy in notes of pear and lemon. This is easy, fruity and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Gentle but clean notes of green and yellow pear create an appealing nose. The palate presents the same tones, assisted by lemon brighteness. This is a vivid, fresh and easy wine, with a dry, slender body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2016 Prestige Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A hint of bruised apple plays on the nose but the palate shows ample freshness in flavors of ripe pear and apple, with a tart lemon balance. This is fruity and easy but also rather refreshing. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Pristine lemon and yellow apple notes are marked by saline minerality and whiffs of smoke and nuts in this briskly composed Pinot Blanc. Dry and medium bodied in style, it's a revitalizing, cutting sip, with a moderately long lime-zest finish. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Saarstein 2016 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: Lovely freshness of cut Conference pear rises from the glass. The rounded palate offers more fruit yet is maintained by a fresh vein of acidity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bott Frères 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Beautifully aromatic hints of Williams pear play on the nose. The palate stays in the same vein, yet ultimately this is easy, friendly and very appetizing. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Very appetizing notes of ripe, juicy and aromatic pear are immediately apparent. The juicy palate frames these lively fruit notes with great freshness. The finish is a little warm but dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Charles Sparr 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Just a touch of Conference pear hits the nose which appears in the same, subtle way on the dry palate. The body is slender and fresh while the finish is clean and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
