Description: There is a distinctly sweet edge to this wine, suggesting that some residual sugar remains. Flavors and scents show honey and peach, with a hint of apple tart as well. Though made entirely in stainless steel, there's a light streak of caramel in the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Maysara 2016 Autees Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The best of Airlie's current white wine releases, this is bright and fruity, with cucumber and green apple in the mix. The mouthfeel is lively, and the flavors show a bit of residual sugar, resulting in an impression not entirely unlike vinous Gatorade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Airlie 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Notes of very ripe pear dominate the nose. The palate shows more freshness to aid the spicy pear fruit on the midpalate. This is dry and fresh, with a slightly lemony finish. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A rather neutral nose offers glimpses of pear and lemon. The palate is also reticent but the pear fruit it shows is fresh, clean and edged with zesty lemon. This is light, dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2016 Cuvée Balthazar Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A rather closed nose hints at lemon. The palate has lemon freshness but lacks a little focus. Nonetheless this is fresh and clean, with an appetizing citrus note on the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp, racy and precise, this particular clone of Pinot Blanc is a rarity anywhere, especially in Oregon. Brisk apple and white-peach fruit comes with a scent of lemon verbena. The finishing tannins have a grainy expression. This would tuck in well with foods usually accompanied by a Loire Valley dry white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Origin 2016 Z'ivo Vineyard Gouges Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This racy wine was pressed whole cluster and aged sur lie in neutral oak for nine months. It's textural and fresh, with flavors of bright apple set against a mineral base.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser 2016 Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: A touch of pear peel is joined by a fresh lemon aroma on the nose. The palate offers a crisp lemon flavor that brightens the light, dry and easy-drinking body. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An aromatic hint of Williams pear plays on the nose. The palate is fresh, clean and vivid, with the pear fruit highlighted by fresh lemon. This is a dry, appetizing and refreshing wine with a slender body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 The Furst Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle hints of yellow pear appear on the nose and lead to a very fruity palate where ripe and juicy pear flavors are boosted by lemon freshness. An easy-drinking, fruity number to drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2016 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A rather neutral nose merely hints at some citrus and pear. The palate is more forthcoming with fresh, lively lemon that frames ripe pear. This is juicy, balanced and refreshing, with a dry and fruity finish. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2016 Portrait Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A hint of ripe pear can be discerned on the closed nose. The palate is clean and fresh, with just a little texture. This is an easy, light and dry wine. Enjoy soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A rather neutral nose just hints at freshness. The dry palate is light in feel, with lemon and pear flavors. Overall this is light, off-dry and fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2016 Val Saint Gregoire Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Pure and fresh notes of freshly cut Conference pear are immediately apparent. The same light, pure, fresh fruit plays on the slender, dry palate. This is an crowd-pleaser of a wine, with lovely balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A touch of cream joins the pear note on the nose. The palate, however, has a main theme of fresh lemon on a slender, dry body. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose wants to give almost nothing away. The palate, however, presents subtle green pear and yellow plum on a very slender, dry body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2016 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An earthy overtone sits on the nose. The palate has a similarly earthy ring but adds gentle pear and lemon notes to a very light, dry body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Mirabelle plum and very ripe pear create a fruity expression on the nose. That same fruit is abundant on the palate. This is a fruity wine with a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2015 Kritt Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of yellow plum have an edge of freshness on the nose. The plum notes also pervade on the juicy, fruit-driven palate. This is light easy, dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of pear and lemon rise from the rather neutral nose. The palate comes in with far more fruit in notes of ripe apple and pear, with freshness and a creamy aspect. This is a fruity, easy, dry wine. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2015 Evidence Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Subdued notes of ripe, yellow pear play on the nose and palate. Freshness balances this beautifully, giving it a dry, crisp finish. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Les Natures Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose offers a touch of ripe pear. The palate shows less fruit and majors on a neutral but clean and balanced, dry body. This is simple but refreshing. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Koenig Vins Alsace 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A rather neutral nose does not give much away. The palate is in a similarly neutral vein, yet it is clean, fresh and balanced. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2016 Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Overtly fruity aromas of ripe pear and lemon have an almost tropical element about them. These fruit tones remain abundant on a light, easy body. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2016 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A touch of ripe pear appears on the nose. The palate adds lemon freshness to the pear flavor and comes together in a balanced, fruity and dry body. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Fritsch 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose is closed and does not want to give too much away. The palate, however, has lovely lemon and fresh pear fruit on a rather light, dry body. This is fresh, easy and fairly neutral, but clean and fresh. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2016 Anne de K Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Ripe and fruity notes of yellow Mirabelle plums make for an appetizing nose. The palate has a similarly rich impression but lacks a little direction and focus. There is plenty of fruit and lemon brightness. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Nothing but the slightest hint of lemon appears on the closed nose. The palate is clean and fresh, just hinting at green pear. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Hints of fresh, green pear and a touch of lemon appear on the nose. The palate offers more of the same on a dry, light body which lacks a little focus. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2016 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A hint of smoked nuts lends a savory tone to flavors of pressed apple and pear. While delicate in concentration, it's dry and approachable, with refreshing lemon-lime acidity. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)

Description: Ripe pear notes signal a fresh, fruity wine. The palate is slightly dilute but offers crisp lemon to brighten a fairly neutral but dry palate. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Aimé Guthmann 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Bruised apple peel and very ripe, yellow pear signal ripeness and abundant fruit. While the palate is light it is similarly generous with fruit, helped along by a touch of residual sweetness. This is fruity and friendly, with an off-dry finish. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Reduction clings to the nose but the body is fresh and clean. This is dry and lacks a little fruit and direction but has freshness to redeem itself. The finish is dry and clean. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Cuvée Réserve Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A touch of smoke, a hint of bruised apple and buttery richness: all of these aromas hint at a complex wine. Yeasty, leesy texture is in the foreground here, rather than fruit. But lemon freshness pervades that salty, moreish creaminess. A dry, sophisticated Pinot Blanc for those who appreciate subtlety and nuance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trapl 2016 Ried Gaisberg Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)

Description: This wine's beautiful red and yellow apple fruit has a zesty edge of lemon. On the palate, a more textured element reminiscent of apple peel and lemon pith adds body. Freshness pervades the wonderfully elegant and earthy flavors. The finish is bright, dry and fresh with lemon. Lovely now, it's sure to develop. Drink 2018–2028.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2016 Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: Fresh, bright hints of Golden Delicious apples meet zesty lemon notes and a wet pebble stoniness on the nose of this wine. With air, the fruit grows more insistent. The palate is beautifully svelte and lets the apple and ripe pear fruit shine. Lemony freshness lends precision. There is concentration and just a little heat on the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tinhof 2016 Weissburgunder (Leithaberg)

Description: A hazelnut element lends richness to the slender, translucent, bright Golden Delicious apple and ripe pear notes in this wine. It seems infinitely svelte and rich at the same time. The palate is smooth with ample brightness but ripples with fresh and unclouded brightness. The finish is dry, fresh and very long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2016 Alte Reben Weisser Burgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: A touch of hazelnut and smoke accompanies the flowing green and yellow apple notes on the nose of this wine. The palate adds a touch of yeasty richness without distorting its svelte translucency in the slightest. The bright green and yellow apple notes are free to swirl against this finely-tuned backdrop. The finish is dry, fresh, yeasty, fruity and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Netzl 2016 Ried Bärnreiser Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)

Description: A mere glint of orange peel accents the subtle creaminess already apparent on the nose of this wine. Yeasty complexity and richness characterizes the concentrated palate. Bright lemon notes pervade those rich layers with freshness, finishing with dry, lip-smacking clarity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stift Klosterneuburg 2016 Ried Jungherrn Weissburgunder (Vienna)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon skin meet with hints of toast and pecan wood on the nose of this bottling from Bien Nacido Vineyard. Mandarin pith, lemon rind and toasty croissant flavors show on the subtle palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Steele 2016 Pinot Blanc (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very pale yellow in color, this bottling shows aromatic pear and lime juice on the broad yet sharp nose. The texture is a bit flat on the sip, and the peachy flavors are quite strong, with yellow pear in the midpalate and a slightly vinous touch on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Pinot Blanc (Central Coast)

Description: It seems trite to call an Oregon wine Burgundian, but in this instance it fits perfectly. Elegant from start to finish, it combines lemon and grapefruit flavors with minerally acidity, driving the palate forward with sleek, racy freshness that calls a particularly excellent Mâcon to mind. Roughly one third was aged in clay amphora, the rest in neutral oak.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winderlea 2016 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Description: Crisp lemon, tangerine and green apple are zippy and thirst quenching in this dry Pinot Blanc. It's an intently mineral wine, boasting deep veins of crushed stone and mineral. The finish is brisk but pristine. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2016 Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Pristine and pert, this zippy dry-style Pinot Blanc offers loads of thirst quenching refreshment. Tart tangerine and lemon flavors are fresh and juicy on the palate. The finish is brisk but nuanced by hints of earth and blossom. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2016 RK Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: Orange blossoms and lime pith perfume this full-bodied Pinot Blanc. Juicy grapefruit and lemon flavors are plush on the palate, but there's also a deep mineral core. The finish is pristine and pure. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2016 100 Hills Dry Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All the white wines from this budget-friendly label managed by Joe Dobbes are simply excellent values. In this new vintage, the Pinot Blanc stands out for its tart, racy mix of citrus, apple and white peach fruit. It's exactly the sort of white to drink on a weeknight with a simple pasta or chicken dish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Savory hints of pollen and earth juxtapose bright tangerine, lemon and apple in this dry Pinot Blanc. Light bodied and zesty in style, it's a rejuvenating sip with wide appeal. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2016 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: Plumes of blossom and stone fruit on the nose turn quieter on the palate of this dry, slightly demure Pinot Blanc. Crisp lime, lemon and apple tones are refreshing. The finish reverberates with bitter lime pith and crushed mineral notes. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2016 vom Löss Pinot Blanc (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The best of the winery's current release white wines, this offers fresh and well-defined apple and tart melon flavors. It seems to have spent some time in barrel, but the acidity balances the oak flavors well.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carlton Cellars 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, can be a rather subdued grape. But it's delightfully bright and zippy here, boasting sunny shades of apricot, grapefruit and tangerine offset against dazzling lemon-lime acidity. It's brisk and cutting on the palate yet finishes with persistence.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Thörle 2016 Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: Beautiful aromas of creamy apple, white flower and ripe pear carry over to the bright delicious palate along with a hint of lemon zest. Crisp acidity lifts the lingering finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2016 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Alluring scents of white flower and beeswax fill the glass. Smooth and full bodied, the rich palate doles out ripe apple and pear set against a round polished texture.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Spessa 2015 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The alpine conditions at Foris push this into a style that's different from Willamette Valley Pinot Blancs. Bracing minerality drives this bus, with refreshing flavors of celery, cucumber and green melon. It's persistent, squeaky clean and quite delightful.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2016 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

Description: From a single parcel of organically grown Pinot Blanc, this was partially vinified in wood. It is dry, although the fruitiness of the grapes balances that dryness. The result is a rich wine, full of fruitiness and with a toasty edge that adds complexity. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Piollot Père et Fils 2013 Colas Robin Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One-quarter of this wine was fermented in neutral oak, the rest in stainless steel. At 12.5% alcohol, the light, almost airy wine brings immaculate fruit flavors of apple and pear, with a pleasing, minerally mouthfeel. It offers the faintest suggestion of caramel as it winds down.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: St. Innocent 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Delicate yellow peach and crushed mineral on the nose extend to the palate of this brisk, zesty Pinot Blanc. It's a refreshing, light footed wine but a bit lean and a bit austere in style. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vinum Autmundis 2015 Umstädter Stachelberg Kabinett Trocken Pinot Blanc (Hessische-Bergstrasse)

Description: A lifted note of dried citrus signals ripeness. The palate has the same honeyed expression of dried citrus but fizzes with freshness on a very light body. Easy and fresh with a lip-smacking, dry finish, it makes for an ideal apéritif.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei NV Méthode Traditionelle Pinot Blanc (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This late-harvest wine was frozen cryogenically and aged in neutral casks prior to bottling. It's mid-level sweet, with much higher alcohol than most such efforts. Candied pears come to mind, with residual phenolic bitterness in the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2015 Hans & Lena Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: This wine shows reductive notes initially, requiring aeration to burn off the aromas. The palate is sharp-toned, with simple flavors of apple, making it perfect for simple enjoyment.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2015 Estate Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Concentrated melon and mango flavors in this ripe, almost tropical, Pinot Blanc are off set by kicks of lime and steel on the midpalate. Dry and bold in weight, it's a luscious, composed sip ending on a pleasant bite of astringency.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Heron Hill 2016 Reserve Morris Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a very accessible white wine for those seeking a reliable alternative that's both bright and flavorful. Aromas of coconut, poached pear, chamomile and white flowers show on the broadly painted nose, while the palate is clean and crisp with apple, zippy acidity and a chalky minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J Wilkes 2015 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: Refreshing and vibrant, this wine is delightfully playful in peach, pear and a lingering spectrum of citrus that gives it additional life in the glass. Light, it'll do well on its own or with creamy cheeses or oysters from the sea.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gloria Ferrer 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From the producer's original, own-rooted 1965 plantings, this light, dry and lovely wine offers citrus and apple skin flavors, along with hints of leafy greens. The fruit skin flavors persist through its lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: David Hill 2016 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Steely and firm, this is taut to the point of muscular. Its tart apple fruit is accented with lemon rind flavors, suggesting some prolonged skin contact. Drink now through 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elk Cove 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Although the label indicates this is sourced from old vines, no actual date for that vague term is given. It's elegant though, and completely dry, layering its delicate herb, lemon peel and apple flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Paetra 2016 Coast Range Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This clean, fresh and fine-tuned wine brings apple, green melon and green leaf flavors together, with a burst of tangy acidity. A perfect pour for pasta and poultry dishes.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brigadoon 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's lime, kiwi and Asian pear flavors come with a spicy kick. Four months on the lees seems to have helped smooth out the midpalate, which leads to a pleasantly creamy finish dappled with hints of dried straw.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2016 David's Block Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Quite ripe and fruity, this full-bodied wine brings apple, pear and peach fruit in abundance. It's almost over-the-top, with some noticeable heat on the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Spindrift Cellars 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Hazelnut and lemon can be sensed briefly on the nose. The palate adds bright lemon notes and riper notions of yellow Mirabelle plum, with an overall impression of freshness and stony depth on the midpalate texture. The finish is clean, dry and lasts long, with a pure lemon note.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2016 Heideboden Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: A faint touch of hazelnut plays on the lemon aromas of the nose. The palate has a lingering combination of the two, plus a zesty, phenolic texture that has slight but pleasantly bitter edges plus more fruit, akin to ripe, yellow apple. This is a rounded Pinot Blanc with potential. Drink now–2022.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2016 Ried Seeberg Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: The merest touch of peach and Golden Delicious apple plays on the nose. The palate features lively lemon notes on a very slender, brisk and fresh palate, along with a tiny bit of spritz. It shows a depth of fruit: a wine for lovers of subtlety. The crisp apple-peel finish is totally moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Stadlmann 2016 Anning Weissburgunder (Thermenregion)

Description: The restrained nose just gives a glimpse of lemon freshness. Lemon notes intensify on the palate, where they attain a lovely textural feel of pith and zest. A slender wine, it still carries a hint of yeast on the midpalate, but is subtle, clean, slender and fine. The finish is dry and refreshing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Malat 2016 Ried am Zaum Hefeabzug Pinot Blanc (Wachau)

Description: A tropical touch on the nose becomes more subtle on the fresh palate. Fresh spritz enlivens the slender, lemony body. This dry, subtle, fresh and clean white offers nuanced refreshment.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Tement 2016 Steirische Klassik Weissburgunder (Südsteiermark)

Description: Although a flinty touch of reduction still hangs on the nose, freshness and verve await underneath. The palate is juicy, slight, dry and very refreshing. It offers a slender, lemony expression of Pinot Blanc with a clean-cut finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Strauss 2016 Classic Pinot Blanc (Steiermark)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Smoky, slightly nutty aromas dissipate with aeration to reveal fresher notes of apple, lemon and pear here. While closed and tight in profile, fresh acidity and juicy citrus flavors are easygoing and approachable.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Lieb 2015 Reserve Pinot Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: A perennially delicious version of the variety, so rare in these parts, this shines with apple, lemon, cucumber and spicy grapefruit flavors. The acidity is fresh and focused, providing tension as a taste of orange peel lingers on the palate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)

Description: This pure varietal effort includes 20% that was barrel fermented. This is flat-out delicious and overflowing with ripe fruits: a pleasing blend of oranges, peaches and papayas. It's rich enough to stand in for your favorite Chardonnay, while offering flavors that more closely resemble a New World take on a white Rhône blend.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Seufert 2015 Yamhill Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: A restrained nose has hints of fresh pear and lovely wet earth. The pear and earth roundness also continues on the palate where it is met with bright lemony freshness. This results in a balanced, appetizing body. The finish is dry and fresh with a slightly bitter tang.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2016 Cuvée Particulière Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Almost indistinguishable from an all-stainless Chardonnay, this nonetheless offers fine value and clean crisp flavors. The basics of simple white wine are here—green apple and tart lemon, served up fresh and immediately drinkable.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a sharp-edged wine with green-tinged fruits—apples and pears not quite ripe. It pushes accents of herb and stem forward, and will probably drink best with food rather than on its own.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Rich golden and red apple notes play on the nose of this appetizing wine. The palate echos the aroma with both ripe generosity and crisp freshness. It's juicy and textured with a pervasive freshness that brightens everything and a wonderfully clean and lip-smacking finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ecker 2016 Riede Schlossberg Weissburgunder (Wagram)

Description: Green apple, Bartlett pear and citrus aromas follow through to the bright, creamy palate, along with a stony mineral note. An elegant, balanced wine with a fresh, lingering finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiopetto 2015 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: This medium-bodied white delivers mature pear, yellow apple and white peach aromas and flavors. It's riper and rounder than usual but also boasts terrific freshness and elegance for the hot vintage.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Russiz Superiore 2015 Pinot Bianco (Collio)

Description: This wine's neutral nose hints slightly at green pear and lemon. The palate is wonderfully brisk, with lemon and pear fruit that's exquisitely light and refreshing. A versatile white with a clean finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Höpler 2016 Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Description: Enticing Granny Smith apple and fragrant white flower scents take center stage in this delightful white. The apple impressioin carries over to the vibrant palate, along with Bartlett pear notes and bright acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kettmeir 2016 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: It's rare to find Pinot Blanc in Champagne, let alone as a stand-alone grape. From the southern Aube vineyards, it's fruitier and softer than a Chardonnay-based wine. That makes it accessible, smooth, creamy and just ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Chassenay d'Arce 2008 Extra Brut Pinot Blanc (Champagne)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This late release offers a good look at how the better Oregon white wines can improve with a few additional years in the bottle. Smooth and rich, it mixes pineapple, Asian pear and honeysuckle scents and flavors. Good verve and a light, pleasant hint of fresh herb.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Z'IVO 2012 Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: All stainless steel fermented, and showing a bit more alcohol than the companion reserve, this carries similar flavors of cantaloupe, pear and peach. The core is smooth and rounded off, with just a hint of flesh and herb.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2015 Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)

Description: Aged on its lees for over 10 years, this stunning wine shows the extraordinary aging potential of Pinot Bianco in Alto Adige. It boasts enticing scents of ripe orchard fruit, vanilla, graphite and a whiff of oak that carry over to the radiant palate along with ripe apple, candied lemon drop and nectarine zest. Bright acidity lends balance while a flinty mineral note backs up the lingering finish. Loaded with finesse and complexity, it's simply gorgeous.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terlan 2004 Rarità 2004 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Crisp and delicious, this elegant wine delivers aromas and flavors of green apple, crushed stone, ripe pear and a hint of pastry cream. Bright acidity lifts the creamy flavors while a tangerine note gives it a clean mouthwatering finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Schulthauser Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicate aromas of ripe orchard fruit and crushed stone lift out of the glass while the fresh rounded palate delivers mature apple and citrus. Crisp acidity lends balance while a savory mineral note closes the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elena Walch 2015 Kristallberg Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Fragrant and delicious, this elegant wine offers enticing scents of green apple, ripe pear and Mediterranean herb. The aromas carry over to the radiant palate along with creamy pear and a stony mineral note. Crisp acidity gives it a clean, racy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terlan 2014 Vorberg Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Glossy and structured, this opens with aromas suggesting acacia honey, toasted hazelnut, crushed stone and a hint of light spice. The smooth but firm palate offers mature yellow apple, tangerine zest and a honeyed mineral note while fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors. Drink through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2013 Sanctissimus Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: This opens with alluring aromas of Granny Smith apple, citrus zest and a hint of flint. On the creamy palate, notes of Alpine herb and mineral accent Abate Fetel pear and tangy nectarine. Lively acidity gives it a crisp finish. While enjoyable now, it will also drink well for several years. Enjoy through 2020.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2015 Anna Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Enticing scents of apple, chamomile flower and peach float out of the glass and carry over to the smooth, concentrated palate along with lemon drop, mineral and a hint of vanilla. It's loaded with finesse while careful oak aging lends complexity. Drink through 2021.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2013 Sanct Valentin Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: While its nose suggests zesty green herbs and lime peel, the palate of this delightfully brisk Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, is sunny with fruit. Crisp nectarine and tangerine flavors are concentrated and fresh, marked by crush ed mineral notes on the finish. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Prinz Salm 2015 Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen)

Description: This opens with enticing aromas of chamomile flower, white peach and a whiff of Alpine herb. The elegant palate offers McIntosh apple, candied lemon and a vein of energizing mineral. Fresh acidity lends balance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2014 Passion Riserva Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Bright and creamy, this savory white offers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, Bartlett pear, Alpine herb and a citrus note. Fresh acidity and a mineral vein energize the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Terlan 2015 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of mature apple, chamomile flower and Alpine herb lead the way on this elegant, structured white. The creamy palate offers ripe pear, graphite and lemon zest alongside fresh acidity that lends balance.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2015 Passion Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Appealing aromas of acacia flower, Alpine herb and citrus follow over to the refined palate along with yellow apple, Bartlett pear and lemon zest. Crisp acidity brightens the creamy flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2015 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Delicately scented, this opens with whiffs of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The crisp palate mirrors the nose, offering apple, pear and citrus, alongside bright acidity. A hint of wet stone wraps up the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Andriano 2015 Finado Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)

Description: Savory smoke and mineral tones persist throughout this light-bodied Pinot Blanc, lending a shadowy cast to its fresh lemon and lime flavors. It's refreshing, with a brisk, revitalizing finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schloss Saarstein 2014 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: Delicate crisp yellow apple and tangerine flavors are laced with dusty pollen and crushed mineral tones in this dry white. While medium bodied, it's pleasantly creamy in texture, brightened by a streak of lemony acidity on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Wittmann 2015 100 Hills Dry Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)

Description: White floral and lemon zest scents perfume this zippy, light-footed Pinot Blanc. It's not a deeply concentrated wine but offers sunny yellow apple and citrus flavors, warmed by a touch of caramelized sugar. The finish is crisp and slightly mineral.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maximin Grünhäuser 2015 Grosse Lage Pinot Blanc (Mosel)

Description: Whiffs of sun-baked clay and dried thyme lend a savory tone to this dry, medium-bodied white. It's broadly textured on the palate but offers bright yellow apple and lemon flavors. Drink now through 2021.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pflüger 2015 Quarzit Trocken Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Description: Nervy lemon-lime acidity amplifies the fresh apple and pear flavors in this spry dry white. Its invigorating freshness and easy-drinking style lends wide appeal for a value price. Drink now through 2020.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2015 Pinot Blanc (Pfalz)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Norm Yost is considered the sparkling pioneer of Santa Barbara County, and his bubblies continue to excel. This exhibits fresh lemon and lime zest notes, with wet cement, peach blossom and sourdough yeast on the nose. There is a grippy tension to the palate, where lemon, green apple and biscuity flavors intermingle.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Goat Bubbles 2014 Crémant Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delightful wine, principally fermented in neutral oak, and aged sur lie, offers lovely details of apple flesh and skin, white melon, a hint of daikon radish, and the pinpoint persistence that is the mark of superior winemaking. Pinot Blanc can go in various directions in Oregon, but this bright and acidic wine really shows the way to a style that is at once drinkable, complex and food friendly.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brigadoon 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Refined flavors of lime, grapefruit, pineapple, citrus skin and stone combine in a clean crisp delightful wine. The naturally bright and refreshing acidity puts a pleasant pucker into the finish, and will have you reaching quickly for that next glass.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

Description: Very ripe fruit is discernible on nose and palate and gives a sense of generosity with even a touch of spice. Lemony freshness provides a wonderful counterpoint to this generosity and makes for a very appetizing moreish finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Gentle but lovely hints of yellow mirabelle plum are just perceptible on the nose. The palate is light and lithe and meets the scented fruit of the nose with an earthy roundness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Generous notions of ripe pear on the nose acquire an earthier, rounder aspect on the fresh palate. This is generous with fruit, yet fresh and somehow weightless. The finish is long and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2015 la Tulipe Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Very ripe pear plays on the enticing nose. The palate has the same refreshing and appetizing fruitiness. Lemony brightness pervades the light-bodied palate and makes for a very moreish finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2015 Bouquet de Printemps Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A clean-cut nose of green pear leads onto an equally clean-cut palate of fresh pear. There is freshness and lots of lemony brightness on the light but precise palate. This is appetizing and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: There is the slightest touch of juicy mirabelle plum on the nose. The palate is wonderfully clean, crisp and fresh: a real joy. This is extremely appetizing and wonderfully light and has real personality.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2015 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Faint notes of both Conference and Bosc pear scent the nose. These notions also appear on the light-bodied palate where they have an earthier aspect and are presented with a very appetizing freshness and clean finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Crisp notes of freshly peeled pear mingle with a creamier aspect on the nose. The palate is a similarly appetizing and attractive mix of crisp freshness and creamy roundness. The body is very light but clean. The finish shines with fresh lemon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2014 Cuvée Les Amours Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A touch of vanilla clings to the yellow pear on nose and palate. The palate adds the merest hint of butterscotch spice. The body is balanced and fresh, clean, generous and intriguing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Josmeyer 2015 H Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Gentle apple and spice rise from the glass. The palate is similarly rich with fruit: fresh apple, ripe pear and some yellow plum. The body is light and fresh with a lasting fruitiness and a lemony finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2015 Prestige Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Bosc pear plays on nose and palate. The ripe and aromatic fruit is countered by ample freshness and even a little spice on the palate. There is a wonderful crispness to the body and the finish. That lasting sense of pears makes you want to sip again.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The lovely and lively citrus-inflected nose of pear is very inviting. The palate comes across as more earthy and rounded. The body is light and easy, but has a subtle moreish texture.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2015 Barriques Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: A distinct aromatic notion of rose petals perfumes the nose. The palate is more in keeping with Pinot Blanc's more restrained nature but is light, fresh and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose is very shy: a mere hint of earthiness emanates. The slender palate shows very clean fruit of yellow apple residing on a slender lemony palate. This is fresh and sprightly with a dry finish. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Both ripe mirabelle and yellow juicy pear appear on the nose. The palate brims with the same fruit. The body is precise and fresh with a lip-smacking citrus finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2015 Les Trois Terroirs Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose of juicy plum promises ripe fruit. The palate follows with a generous softness. There is ease on this light body and lots of freshness. Enjoy while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Soft appetizing pear peel entices the nose. The palate almost has a kind of apple freshness and a wonderfully fruity, attractive if very light-bodied nature. The finish is clean and moreish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: The nose is rather closed but the palate offers very friendly gentle notes of ripe pear. The body is light and harmonious with plentiful fruit and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Fresh-faced, appetizing hints of pear peel and freshly sliced Conference pear characterize this fresh light-bodied wine. The palate is light, rounded and undemanding. It's easy and clean drinking.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2015 Bonheur Convivial Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose tells us little—there's just a hint of pear-scented freshness. The palate is light bodied and fresh with the same appetizing glints of pear. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2015 Portrait Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Gentle but lovely hints of yellow mirabelle plum are just perceptible on the nose. The palate is light and lithe and meets the scented fruit of the nose with an earthier roundness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Gentle friendly notes of yellow mirabelle plum play on the nose. The palate is equally fruity and appetizing, chock-full of fruit and freshness. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Dopff & Irion 2015 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: Tender notions of ripe pear make for an enticing nose. The palate has apple freshness and a rounded earthy aspect, despite its lightness. Drink soon.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2015 Les Natures Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: An extremely fruity nose comes across as fresh and peachy. The body is less aromatic but crisp and very light. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine François Schmitt 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose does not give a lot away and is very neutral—just a mere hint of freshness. The palate provides gentle fresh fruit and is rounded. Drink soon while aromas are at their peak.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2015 Vieille Vigne Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)

Description: Very gentle notions of ripe pear color the nose. The palate is more toned down, with an earthy edge. The body is light and fresh. Drink while aromas are at their height.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The peel of Bosc pear and riper stone fruit are the chief aromatic markers of this wine. The palate is light, slight and crisp with an earthier, slightly bitter edge. Drink soon while aromas are at their height.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2014 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: The nose is rather neutral, the palate follows in a similar but clean fashion. This is light bodied and clean, with just a little hint of earthiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2015 Val Saint Gregoire Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

Description: This is all about understatement: there is a waft of oyster shell on the nose, nothing more. The palate, however, displays ample depth of stony, almost salty intensity. There is nothing obvious about this wine, just depth and concentration that will take time to come into their own. This needs bottle age and will come out nutty, poised and rounded. Drink 2019–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2015 Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: A sonorous touch of vanilla lends its smoky aspect to the bright fruit of this intriguing Pinot Blanc. The palate, which is compact, streamlined and concentrated, revels in those smoky notes and will need time to unveil its gentle white-currant fruit. Lemony freshness preserves everything. This is one for the long run. Drink 2022–2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Prieler 2015 Ried Haidsatz Pinot Blanc (Leithaberg)

Description: This slender but expressive Pinot Blanc is possessed of a wonderfully light touch. Right now, yeasty tones still swing alongside the bright stone fruit but this will soon come into its own and show off the slender but distinct and food friendly nature of Pinot Blanc. Revel in the subtle stony depth and elegance of this wine. Its long finish tells you everything.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ebner-Ebenauer 2015 Alte Reben Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: The first vintage of this variety for this producer, this lovely white comes from a rare and renowned site in Green Valley. An austere nose of lemony green apple and honey follows through on the crisp, light-bodied palate. Floral in apple blossom, it reveals a touch of wet stone on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Dutton Ranch Shop Block Cool Climate
Name: Ron Rubin 2015 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Cool Climate Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)

Description: The nose is a very inviting and attractive mix of bright blossom honey and ripe lemon peel: the palate follows with rounded richness that is streamlined by lovely unobtrusive freshness. It's a generous but harmoniously balanced wine and certainly a very good take on the much underrated Pinot Blanc grape.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Netzl 2015 Bärnreiser Weissburgunder (Carnuntum)

Description: A smoky, almost meaty tone of hazelnut is the first impression on the nose. This smokiness carries over onto the lemon zest, which defines the palate. This is poised and streamlined and will stand its gentle but firm ground at the table.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Martinshof 2015 Reserve Weissburgunder (Niederösterreich)

Description: At present, the full hit of generous oak holds sway over this wine, bathing everything in shades of warm vanilla. The palate responds to this with freshness and some concentration at the core. If you love the flavors of oak and generous roundedness, you will love this.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hillinger 2015 Terroir Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Crisp lemon, apple and pear abound in this richly textured yet pertly balanced Pinot Blanc. It's an easy quaffing, elegant wine with hints of nut and toast that extend elegantly on the finish. Drink now through 2020.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Heron Hill 2015 Reserve Morris Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: A rich backdrop of cream and toast bolsters this delicate apple-scented wine. While light in body and concentration, its lingering silkiness is pleasant and comforting. Drink now through 2019.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Glenora 2015 Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)
